B5KtTABTJTPHST6pLEtIBw.review_text: It's a nice place.  Their backroom is hidden from the rest of the lounge, which is a nice little touch for private parties.  The first time I went there was on a regular Saturday night and it was quite small and crampt, which I didn't particularly enjoy.  The last time however, I went for a private party where the entire location was rented out.  With only a limited number of people it is much easier to enjoy the lounge.  The back room had a small bar which lets you grab a limited assortment of drinks without leaving to the main room, and the full bar upfront offers a large selection of booze for those that desire it.    Prices are good, not too cheap, not too pricy.  Parking sucks of course, but there is a parking garage on the other side of that same block (next to the police station, so I guess it's safe?).

HFECrzYDpgbS5EmTBtj2zQ.review_text: When I first mapped Rosewood on Google, it initially struck me odd that it's located in the part of Chinatown that has spilled over into North Beach. I also knew that parking was going to be a challenge. Luckily, the Parking Karma that I learned as a previous City resident came back, and I ended up on Green at a 90 degree slope spot. From there, I enjoyed the walk around, even though Rosewood is almost as hard to find in person.   What brought me to the City from the Burbs on a Week Day? Was I trying to escape the bar fights in Walnut Creek or the Oakland Occupy scene? The real answer is that my OCD-fueled fondness of writing reviews has a few privileges, even though I'm older and uglier than the target demographic. I was in fact honored to be at Rosewood as part of the inaugural Gogobot Pro class. And when you consider that there were lots of fellow Yelpers and least 2 past or current CMs at the party, its a small world for Real People and Real Reviews.®   There's lots of interesting twists and turns to Rosewood and what initially looks like a small venue has lots of room. During this party, the drinks and too loud music were up front, the photo "booth" was off to the side, while Pizza, Milk and Cookies, and a chance for quieter conversation was available out back. And when you put all this together, the party had a pleasant energy and flow.   I had a very nice time. Connie was back from Loopt and did a smashing job organizing the party and in her usual hard working and classy way. I spent my time nursing a gin-based "Martinez in Bloom" drink (courtesy of a friendly and very hard working Bar Keep), munching on square slices of Golden Boy Pizza, and chatting up travel adventures with various folks. One fascinating conversation addressed the "spiritual work" aspects of walking the Camino de Santiago for non-Catholics. Later on and as long as folks would listen, I enthusiastically promoted my ongoing participation in Climate Change-related volunteer trips with Earthwatch. Many thanks to Travis K. and his Gogobot Team for making all this possible!  The Highlight of the party however was the presence of Rene C., his wife Erica, and Joanna M. Only his MC was missing, of which Rene's lovely bride has graciously opted to let him dream and maybe sometimes make an ASS of himself. We had a great conversation which continued into the evening (with Joanna's friend MM joining us) at Park Tavern. It was one of those few times during the week when I wasn't in any hurry to have the evening end.   Gayle will sometimes ask: Who are these virtual friends of yours? Are they really friends? Have you actually met any of them? My answer is Yes and often involving very enjoyable situations both within and separate from a special event.

Sg_BvnTHsbc1AABiJjaiPA.review_text: Small bar with a dance floor, good music. Too bad no one was dancing and the place was pretty much empty. What..? On a Friday night?

tQqIEVhLWOr02cmJ6NpamA.review_text: Rosewood, oh Rosewood. I how can I count the ways!  We had our WEDDING at Rosewood on July 9th and it was amazing. I know Rosewood doesn't necessarily seem like the best spot for a wedding venue, but it was PERFECT! First of all Toni and her staff met with us about 10 times before the wedding. Then they totally accomodated a bunch of our wedding worries and requests.   The space is so unique with all the little rooms and the outside patio. Our guests had so many little areas to interact, meet new people, and mingle. It was great. We added a bit of mood lighting and some wall decorations and Rosewood turned in to our hip wedding oasis.  The drinks were strong and everyone felt very well taken care of. The service was friendly and top notch.   We can't thank Toni and her staff enough for making our wedding one of a kind and soooooo great!

zTE8KUu2ukFQZ67fZypLtA.review_text: i like this place because it's got a little bit of everything.  a place to sit and chill, a bar, a dance floor, a patio.  decent hip hop that often reverts back to the 80's and 90's, which makes me nostalgic, and makes dancing more fun since i've grown up with this kind of music.   i prefer it to clubs because it's laid back.  a bit of a yuppie crowd, in my opinion...that may be your thing, or not.

4glia_ud1LJzXCGnGy3xWQ.review_text: Wow, I really like this place -- nice decor, not too crowded, feels like a neighborhood bar in NYC to me.  Music was on the hip-hop/R&B side which is just fine by me.   In my continuing search for a reasonable lounge in this town, this is a pretty good stop -- will definitely go again soon

HYQoxBC1y1DGPq6pGP09Tw.review_text: Every time when Matt walks up and down the busy Broadway St., this bar is always deserted and appears to be dull and haunted. Until this day, when Yelp held its encounter of the DJ's between Yelpers. Many of the coolest Yelpers displayed their prized skills on how to spin a record and amaze the Chinatown neighborhood.   Matt came here after his breakfast, (working graveyard) and passed by this bar for a short visit and surprised many Yelpers, that Matt still has a little life and heart in attending to these awesome events.  With the tainted stench of Curry Beef lingering in his breath, Matt did his best to conceal his Curry breath and chatted with more yelper. (wanna kiss?) But with the interference of work, Matt's stay was very brief, but fun.

8Q0xnxT-KrvCl2pQF1qsFQ.review_text: came here for the DJ soiree organized by Jing Tao Fuckface.  i was kind of nervous as it has been a while since being around a horde of sweaty, horny yelpers-- but i was ahead of schedule on my Summer reading list and needed a break from organizing my stamp collection. on approaching the spot i hugged it out with Special K and after we made out i was persuaded to let Omid T. give me his signature "dirty sanchez."  all of this took place outside and we received applause from on-lookers. as entering and making way for a refreshment a big-man with big-muscles mauled me from behind just as i made it to the bar...thankfully it was just my bud luis m. as i was sure i was about to have my "salad tossed." ordered a healthy, yummy round of greyhound (greygoose) and gin&tonic (sapphire) to cool down from an attractive bartender...chatted a bit with Pookie W who explained the mystery of the "nappy dugout" which i was thankful for.   after chatting a bit in the cozy, bamboo-infested patio watching euge I show off his six-pack to the smoking crowd he began to contemplate with us on his theory "game of inches."  Supposedly turtles are a sexual beast. i was immediately mauled by Durian Loving Steph P as i crossed the dancefloor to make way to the head and well...she picked me up and rampantly "McQ'd" me against the wall to the juicy dancehall cooked-up by Selecta Ben. I immediately ran to the restroom to "dance with the captain." a dance cypher started brewing which involved A J, myself, Bucky K, and JT F...Bucky was the clear winner with his robot and pop-locking. Rosewood is the kinda romper-room designed perfectly for the intimate yelp gathering we had which was full of liquid and acts that can only be explained through sex lex-icon-- sex-lexis.com

3ybJXMA4RarhAqtO8Dv6MA.review_text: By no means a destination for the dance-inclined. There was a ghost DJ... that turned out to just be a playlist on a laptop somewhere! Reveling in that 4 second pause between songs, I looked around and asked myself, "Really?"   This question popped into my mind more than once, actually:  - when they played "teach me how to dougie"  - when they played "call me maybe"  - when I took a sip of my Gimlet and I discovered that it was literally only gin and lime. I guess that is all it takes to be a Gimlet, but without simple syrup, it tastes sad. Good to know next time I order it anywhere else, to make sure theres something sweet in there.  I remember reading that the bartenders were top notch on Yelp - and I would only go back to try something more complicated/interesting to see them really show off. But alcohol to me isn't as important as a great DJ. I don't want to drink to distract myself from the bad music - I want to drink to enhance something that is already bumpin'.  I can't say anything about the back patio because it was booked for a private party.   Not my type.

g2YnG8VUb9opaWF6fx6viQ.review_text: This NB bar is a hip and stylish hip hop club. The music is always bumpin and the girls are always dancing. I haven't been here on a weekend and on the weekdays it starts to pick up around 10pm. The sound system is very impressive, maybe a bit too loud for my tastes. I woke up with a hoarse voice from shouting.

EVfNM3vsq_zWvR4dI5Qytw.review_text: hire another bartender for the main room along with a beer booth in your empty coat room, and this rating might be five stars.  otherwise, another good night at rosewood.

OcUC2eFhJJK9mG6K4abmXA.review_text: I went to Rosewood last night for a birthday party. What a great spot! You can rent out the back room, which is spacious AND provides access to the back porch area.  We had our own private bartender, great drinks (the lemon chiffon was fab), and could play our own music.  Even though it's in North Beach, Rosewood seems low-key and chill. Great find, birthday girl!

l52adgx4Kd_5Wap-0K7Bkw.review_text: Went here on a Saturday night. This place was packed, but there was one bartender working the main bar, and one bartender working the back bar. Absolutely impossible to get a drink, and everyone waiting around seemed to have the same problem. After waiting for about 30 minutes and not being served, we left and went to another bar without spending a dollar.   Nice layout and the place has potential. Not sure who runs this joint, but its a joke.

hc4FcL3cdt0I_IvrDMhp2A.review_text: Popped in here after a nearby gallery opening on Friday night and was pleasantly surprised.  I walk by here all the time and they sadly seem to follow dance club rather than bar hours (only seem to be open past 10 pm on weekends, which is totally counter to the 5 pm - 2 am hours I just noticed they have listed on here.)  I always think it looks like a cute spot, so would love it if they were open more often.    Anyway, we grabbed a couple of drinks and explored the rabbit warren of rooms that make up Rosewood.  Decor is cute, a little bit unfinished (laminate veneer everywhere, peeling off the wall in places) but nice overal aesthetic and really cute couches/seating clusters throughout.  I especially like the bar and outdoor area towards the back - very nice!  I think this would be a great spot for a large group and/or birthday party too.

4IjzfbO7XKFNWWVufHNhww.review_text: A friend and I were looking for the perfect place to throw a surprise birthday party for our pal. Everything went off without a hitch. The emails with Toni were really helpful and she was so nice the night of and very organized. We were able to bring in some balloons, a cake, and they did a specialized cocktail menu based on the birthday girl's love - bourbon! They also have nice touches like a coat rack for the party and a live dj, which was nice for special requests!  The night of the party the bartenders were great, really made the drinks special, and were nice to all the guests. The back patio was rented out, but we were able to get fresh air out there which was nice. We needed a little help getting one tipsy guest home and the bouncer went out of his way to help us till we were in the cab safe.   Overall, this is the perfect hidden gem to rent out for a private party, I would use it or go here again in a heartbeat.

RPD2MK_RJbCY_GFsLAZjig.review_text:
Rosewood is a treat...I will definitely have my BIRTHDAY MONTH  kickoff here and ALL OF my special Yelp friends  (anyone that is on my friends list )will be invited. 
  but I have to share a story.... 
  Circa 2003  ... Bambi hooks up with 2 fabulous chicks at The Redwood room (back when it was cute and it was the place to be at)and decides to take the pretty ladies to make the rounds in North Beach. So after a few stops one of the ladies decides to call her boyfriend who by the way claimed to be a COP from Oakland ... really?more like a drug dealer... and decides that we all head to ROSEWOOD. 
  Now am a small guy and can't really take on a 6'2 giant by myself ... and really don't have much interest in making out with girls unless am drunk and the Manny in me comes out (that's the male Bambi... watch out ladies). So here we are waiting for the BF sitting and chatting it up maybe a bit too close when the BF walks in... no hello, no my name is blah blah..nothing Nada... all I got was ARE YOU MAKING OUT WITH MY GF... IF SO AM GOING TO CUT YOU RIGHT NOW...and pulls out a pocket knife pointing it on my chest and poking me...and of course the GF jumps in between... and Bambi is up and running to the door... without finishing the cocktail. 
  Now every time I go  to ROSEWOOD I get a flashback of that incident and I now I know what the ladies mean about very jealous obsessive,controlling, freaky boyfriends that they can't get rid off. I HAVE HAD AN ENCOUNTER WITH THIS MAN... 
  Funny thing ...I never saw this couple again.

aIk07jxkia9izLMKRbaHHw.review_text: Great tunes, well stocked bar, nice, soothing interior, somewhat hidden from the rest of north beach.  Grab a couch/chair and listen to some hip hop.

FoZ6QIJGbd-2DZ12f34FtQ.review_text: Like Jennifer Y. and Jennifer S., I was also there for Jennifer M.'s birthday party (and it was our friend Sonja's party too but she's not a yelper.)  Anyhoo, I won't repeat what Jennifer squared mentioned but I did really enjoy this place. Let me get the "hmpf" parts about the night:  took a while to get a drink a little small in the private room very smokey outside (totally craved a cigarette but didn't have one) a bit pricey  but there's an upside to all that:  the drinks were very strong and the shots were huge could take a break from the small room in the in front of the place didn't smoke a cigarette! totally worth the money, especially since we had to cover $850 or so  I was impressed and enjoyed the party!

DvcAC_nlKaTDsHcA8Slagw.review_text: A little zen oasis away from the rowdiness that is North Beach nightlife, Rosewood is a great spot to have a drink just on the outskirts of Chinatown.   To be fair, it does get pretty crowded later in the night and honestly, I don't really care for it that much then. But anytime before 10 is normally a great time to grab a beer here and have conversations with friends. Grab a hoegarden or any other great beers on tap, and head on out to the patio. The patio is truly where it's at. It feels like you are having a drink on a patio between Brooklyn brownstones. It's intimate and cozy plus the bamboo creates a very tranquil and chill vibe.   For decent conversation and drinks before 10pm, Rosewood is pretty tough to beat. It's typically not too crowded then so you'll have space even for a larger group. Plus the friendly and attentive bartenders will take great care of you here.

KeZjKwMbqPU2qQO7oGgWLw.review_text: I was debating whether to give this a 3 or 4 star rating as there were good and bad characteristics. The decor is attractive, the DJ rocked (DJ Satva), the doormen were friendly, the crowd was fun and good ratio of men:women (although I was there for a special event in the back area so I was not sure if it was the crowd from that or the normal clientele). We got our drinks quickly and the prices weren't outrageous.  But at 1am, the staff was turning out lights, blowing out candles, turning down the music, and closing down the bar. What the?!! Come on! SF already closes their bars wayyyy to early, can't they at least give us until 1:30am? We all thought it was a buzz kill.

8hvXl0oJmU61l17LG9aDag.review_text: the euge is happy. hes found another bar/lounge he can call home besides dragon lounge in the sunset.   the parking sucks here but ehhh whatever.   jt f, yous badass, that shit last night was awesome.  the bar itself, well, hoegarden on tap. nuff said.   i LOVE this space, a litte dance floor to get yo freak on, awesome patio area, cool vip private back bar....  now if i can only get them to name a drink after me here too......

eeI4DVW43NLBlo6nFkcANw.review_text: Interesting bar and cool outside patio area, loungy vibe.  Nice little dance floor with some nice beats.  Ordered a Greyhound, White Wine, and a Pint.  The bill was $21.00 which is pretty high for a beer, a well and a glass of wine.

k3wjSI44_hXgqMiYHqah7g.review_text: This place is completely hidden and even with google maps in hand we still missed it the first time.   The place is a great secret gem and is a fab place to come if you want to have some drinks and hang out with your friends. There's a sweet spot in the back outside that is great for sitting. The dance floor is small but does the job.   Don't expect it to be crowded but if you're coming with a crowd this place is great. It's small, intimate without feeling stuffy and sweaty.   Bottoms up.

K_hCqC-OASPb22AEgOSGjQ.review_text: Rosewood is kind of funny because it's hidden away in Chinatown close-ish to North Beach but far enough away that randoms don't stumble upon it.  As a result, it's pretty relaxed and chill inside.  I've been here multiple times over the last few years and have never seen this place completely packed ... which can be both a blessing and a curse depending on what you're in the mood for.  I like the small dance floor in the back, and the music is pretty decent.  Again, though, based on the crowd, people may or may not be dancing so you really have to bring the party yourself sometimes.

3F7xpiGrF-4gxzsKzIFhrw.review_text: Toni is the sweetest bar manager I have ever met. Every time we go there she ends up giving us hugs and making us feel welcome at the bar.  The interior is really nicely decorated, and on a nice night it's great to just chill in the bamboo garden in the back.  Just a warning, the drinks are strong, so be prepared to have a good night when you come here.

pDfL8xt8F8ls0-kQIG_ADg.review_text: Me and my friends have a saying, "Up to no good at Rosewood..."  Have a few Hoegaardens from their tap and do the same.

rbPJO1Mc5ddzgucXelSQ0g.review_text: Five stars because of the music and the people that were there to share a lovely night together. Great drinks, great atmosphere, great beats by the great Yelp DJs, and great people.  Nice try to the ladies that tried to get me to dance...*coughAimeecough* *achooprincessooo* Like I said, I may have rhythm because I love music but that doesn't mean I have rhythm in my feet. But apart from that, awesome night. The bartenders were cool and were on top of the drink orders unlike other places that are bigger and have more staffers. Maybe it's because we didn't order mojitos. At least I didn't see anyone with mojitos.  And I love the ass grabbing. YAY!!! I just pray to God they were all from women. Not that I am a homophobe, it's just that I like the ladies more. Sorry guys. I wish all DYLs will be like this. This was fun! YAY!!! AGAIN! AGAIN!!!

I1dKh4olStlU7i-hEi4_TQ.review_text: Great place for small private parties and I had fun celebrating my sis's bf birthday, BUT the music was not good at all and bathrooms were disgusting. They played the same 7 songs over and over again! Wasn't packed at all on a Sat (Thanksgiving wknd) night. No cover and the dance floor isn't crowded so yay!

swocJWD8R1iH20-lveXh0Q.review_text: Not my neighborhood of choice but a small group came here for some bday drinks because the bday girl had dinner relatively near by.  The clientele was very North Beach and the music, hip hop.  The drinks were good, the decor great, like something you would see in SOMA.  The dance floor looked out of place but I guess that's the kind of vibe there were going for.  I probably wouldn't come back since I don't find myself in the Chinatown area very often.  Cute venue though.

Tdsd6ojiId3tgJsBBQz4NA.review_text: I've had a few fun nights at this place.  My favorite memory from Rosewood is this random dude essentially pinning my friend against a wall to dance with her; I think he later posted a "missed connections" ad on craigslist talking about the amazing chemistry they had, or something like that.  If by chemistry, he meant that he almost made her vomit, then he was correct.  I had my 30th birthday here last year and had an awesome time.  The private area in the back with the outdoor tables is pretty cool.  Overall, this place seems like the antithesis of North Beach---minimalist but elegant.

mFt934crYEVqfAfCzR9olw.review_text: One of the best birthday experiences I could ask for. Note, Rosewood isn't by any means the most luxe bar or anything.. In fact it's almost easy to miss because it's right in the middle of Chinatown, but the experience I had there last night by far deserves a 5 star rating.  First off, I worked with Toni over email 2-3 weeks before my party and she reserved the front section of the bar completely free for my party of 20-25. We had complete access to the music so all my friends were taking turns plugging in their iPhone and playing fun tunes.   Toni had the place all set up with flowers, candles, and signs for my party when I walked in. In addition, the bar does something special where you're allowed to name 5 of the cocktails for the night and they change the menus for the night. I chose my 5 favorite male TV characters and it turned out to be such a hit... Especially walking around hearing people say, "I'm having a Pacey Witter" or "What's in the Jesse Pinkman?" ;)  By the middle of the night, the other private event that was going on in the back patio area ended early and the bouncers gave us access to the entire place. It was so nice -- a really cute outdoor patio with lights and seating, as well as another mini dance floor.   Everyone was so nice and warm, which is one of the best experiences you can ask for on your birthday. The bar was still open to visitors so that was also fun to get to know other passerbys who walked in and wanted to know what was going on. Hands down, one of the best spots to have a birthday. Not to mention, a spacious dance floor. (Note: the place is much more of a bar feel and not dance club so don't expect a packed dance floor but even 10 of us on the floor tearing it up made an amazing experience I won't forget).  Thank you Toni SO much for your sweetness! Best night ever :)

yh8_9Ix1wp9dekvyOZbilQ.review_text: Should I be embarrassed to be a fan of Rosewood? Well,  I'm not. When I was a  young lass living on her own in SF, Rosewood provided my friends and I with countless birthday parties, random Friday nights out, and just about any other celebration you can think of. Now that I'm older and don't live in the area anymore, I thought I'd be over it, or that it'd be different somehow. But I recently stopped in for a lark with some friends on a Friday night and guess what... it's EXACTLY the same. That's good and bad. The drinks are still good, the music's still good, and it's still easy peasy to get in. The only problem is that this place is completely dead. Why?? Don't people realize how rare it is to find a place like this without a line snaking down the block?! Add to that the large number of late night Chinese and pizza places within stumbling distance, and it's nearly perfect in my untrendy eyes. Oh well, more Rosewood for me!

_8smAJ_NSJow6xiaKz4mPQ.review_text: I think they could use some better signage. My bf and I drove passed it a couple times and couldn't figure out where it was.

7A5lajj4qvHSDM97Kg-x4g.review_text:
I wanted to give this place three stars, but if I did I'd be rating what I want it to be, and what it isn't anymore. I still like it, still think when it's not too crowded and the lighting's right, that it's a cool place to swizzle a drink, but frankly, it's fallen a bit since the first time I went.
  This place was initially as sleek as the gorgeous photo spread a local paper devoted to it in their sunday supplement -- the one that made me decide on the spot that I had to check the place out. The sleek chrome beer taps and the 007-style furnishings gave you something to check out while you settled into a nice Vodka Martini, and the bamboo/pebble garden, when open to the public, was awesome.
  But now wear and tear, like holes in the walls, show even in the dim orange light, and put a 'never' in front of the 'open to the public' -- 'cause you're pretty much going to have to rent the back room to get out to that garden.
  Also, the place used to have this really cool cross-cultural feeling, with a sprinkling of everyone coming in -- this has been less the case the last few times I've been, which ups the blandness factor.

GpZpKakwykH-Gsw-1LpLHg.review_text: Last night I went to Rosewood for the first time in about five years and I'm annoyed at myself for not going back sooner. It's easily one of the best options in North Beach for a Friday or Saturday night, it's so good that it's actually made me consider going out in North Beach more often. it's far enough from Columbus that you don't get the tourist crowd but close enough that you feel like you're in a happening neighborhood.  The music last night was a bit cheesy, lots of Michael Jackson but there's really nothing wrong with that. The dance floor is on the smaller side but a lot of people weren't up for dancing last night so it didn't cause a problem. I've heard there's an amazing outdoor area in the back but didn't get to check it out due to a private event going on.  As Sonia S. pointed out, they need more restrooms. There are currently only two shared between men and women and the line can get ridiculously long. The management should really just invest in a bit of a remodel, can't imagine it'd cost that much when the benefits are considered.  I'm sure I'll be back, hopefully within the next few months rather than waiting another 5 years to return.

jXIJnnyxXxizxNYEo2ze-A.review_text: nice wood-heavy decor, friendly bartenders that hook you up with strong drinks, and cushy seating along the walls make rosewood a pleasant place to hang. the back room turns into a dance floor eventually (when it gets late and peeps get drunk). it's a little small but i'd definitely go back if i want a low-key lounging experience in the city.

SHBoA7pdjy5Etsl2gAovJw.review_text: I ordered a Redbull Vodka, and watched the bartender pour a Rockstar Vodka.  When I asked if Rockstar Vodka cost the same, the bartender replied "They're the same thing." and charged me $7 for it.  Not my usual drink, but this stuff will get you bad reviews.

5IX9FOesKrLRyz618xc6tw.review_text: For a Saturday nite, it wasn't too crowded but the place is tiny and the music is loud and that makes it really difficult to have conversations with friends. Plus I was starving since I hadn't had dinner other than snacking on some wheat thins at a friend's place prior to coming here. Good thing Rosewood is in the heart of Chinatown. We walked down the street to grab some good grub before coming back to the bar. The doorman even remembered us so that was another plus.

uXSVu2ldBncOGMcvI9SW2Q.review_text: The fabulously adorable bartender taught me how to like Fernet. You, sir, have done the impossible.

DQj7DnJiDV9TAxS0ott-3g.review_text: I recommended a friend have her birthday here solely based on all of the reviews here. The party was fun, but this place was highly disappointing. It was on a Saturday night - the DJ sucked hardcore - it was like top 40 hip hop with super bad transitions... I mean BAD. The bar was crazy crowded, and only one bartender... so that meant wait a while. And there is an incredibly long line for the bathroom - even if you're a guy! I don't know... I don't get why everybody loves this place. I've been to so many better venues around... oh yea, not to mention it's on a pretty shady block of Broadway.

zpXqbJQ2CT4PsUBTy30DbQ.review_text: Ok, so I came here for a birthday party on Friday night.  This place is pretty swanky, although not in a great part of town.  I guess it's still considered North Beach, yet it's in the middle of a bunch of Chinese markets on Broadway and Powell-ish.  Dark inside and SO hot.  It took me AT LEAST 15 minutes each time I went to get a drink.  I don't think they were prepared (even though they knew about the birthday party beforehand) and staffed adequately for the number of people that were there.  The drinks were also not very strong and the bathroom line was ridiculous.  One stall in each bathroom is not enough.  Eh, I probably won't be back. At least not for a birthday party.

Ey7u10UjOz7Urroq4J0a4Q.review_text: one of the hardest places to find. seriously, the windows are tinted limo black and it's in between asian shops...it just seems a tad out of place.  aside from your chances of seeing it, it's not bad inside. if we worked close enough, i'd go here for happy hour, but it seems to be the place for parties. there's a back room/area that has a separate bar from the main one and is definitely sets a great ambience for a par-tay!

DAf3UOAONCpgETWlNTERKg.review_text: I love lounges and bars with a little something for everybody. At Rosewood, one can:  - Sit...in or outdoors!  - Stand  - Smoke  - Drink  - Dance  - Take off your clothes  - Lock yourself in the bathroom  - Have a kickass event/birthday party/general coming together of friends  - Forget to close your tab and have the amazing owner, Greg, kindly arrange delivery   ...all the elements for a memorable *laughs at the irony* night.   *There's only one thing on that list that I have not done at Rosewood, but I wouldn't be surprised to hear that someone else did it...*cough*euge*cough*salty*cough.*

PauNerg-kHRpoqLwB6F5CQ.review_text: I definitely enjoyed this place and could certainly see coming back. Owned by the same people who run Rye and 15 Romolo, the bar staff know their stuff - Toni didn't pause or flinch when I asked about a sazerac and whipped up a fairly good one about as quickly as you can say it. The atmosphere in the main bar is warm though the private 2-room back area is rather stark. The good news is that means you have a fairly blank slate for decorating for your event. There's also a nice patio area with both wooden picnic tables and upholstered settees. Music was playing at a good volume throughout - easily heard but not interfering with conversation. Win.

vLfRgjVHw4zSiKOmM7XvqQ.review_text: Kinda small, pretty loud "meh" beats from the dj behind the bar.  I was pretty concerned for him getting his tables wet from all the drink swilling and spilling going on from the drunks with wildly flailing moves on his end of the bar.  I think they left early for a short walk to the other bars down the main street because it was too crowded and understaffed to get a drink in every 15 minutes.  However, I'd have to say they pour pretty well from the drinks that I ordered, which is to say they poured pretty heavily, which is to say "Yay!"  It got pretty hot in the bar after a while and as soon as we left an almost-fight broke out between a little guy with 2 friends and a larger guy with about 10.  The parking wasn't bad for Broadway on a Saturday night, then again, it was the dark quiet side of Broadway that becomes part of Chinatown whose little shops and markets close down at about 6pm.

v3FadeRQY05oyNU2ergoQw.review_text:
This is one of my favorite bars in North Beach. It has a good vibe, and no one will look at you strangely if you start dancing in the back room. (At least I haven't noticed anyone giving me funny looks, but maybe I'm just in denial.)
  The last time I was there, the last two songs of the night had that Indian dance beat which has been so hot over the last few years. A group next to me (I forget which kind of Indian - one of my friends explained this whole thing to me, and I can't remember right now, so please excuse my ignorance) went CRAZY with the dancing! One of the guys accidentally stepped on my foot, and after apologizing, he showed me how to "unscrew the light bulb... UNSCREW THE LIGHT BULB..." (Imagine putting both hands up and "unscrewing" to the beat of the music.)
  I was so excited I got to learn this dance from a legit source! Well, as legit as he can be, considering we were at Rosewood. I love this place because stuff like this happens here. If only parking were easier...

wpI3AQvA5kxp-moP46m8NA.review_text: I had heard about this place for sometime.  Finally checked it out a couple of weeks ago, and it left me going "ehh it's alright".  Then just a week after that, I was invited to a birthday party at Rosewood.  Second time was a charm.  The place had a way better vibe going on, the wine was tasting pretty good for bar wine , and the music was lots of fun. The piece de resistance was the back room.  So cool and beautiful.  Now that's what I want my apartment to look like :).  If North Beach had more bars/lounges like this,  and not like Fuse (eww), I would be there all the time.

p05BaSFza5U8MRUXAciB2Q.review_text: 3.5 stars  Rosewood is a hip and stylish little lounge located almost on the outskirts of North Beach.  Face it, it's Chinatown.  It's away from the tourist traps that is Broadway/Columbus, but still accessible.  It's an odd spot for a lounge, but it satisfies the soul.  The space itself is spacious and comforting, with a green feel to it, thanks to the wood walls, concrete floors, metal doors, sliding glass doors, and tranquil bamboo lounge garden in the back.  There's ample space for lounging either up in the front, along the side in the bench seats, or out back amidst the garden.  The back area serves as the mini dance floor, if you're so inclined to get up off your ass.  Candles are strategically placed throughout the venue.  And if you're a really special customer, they open up the private room with a separate bar to take care of everyone there.  The owner of Rosewood is cool, as he's allowed Yelpers to overtake his lounge for the past 3 Yelper DJ events, which have been way hot experiences.  My only peeve has been that their drinks are overpriced and the bartenders are a little slow.  The only time that I've seen the place busy is when Yelpers hold parties here.  You'd think they'd offer some drink specials to us by now.  An $8 Ketel One greyhound seems more fitting at Ruby Skye or something like that. Trying to get a drink from them also seems to be a chore to them.  I was waiting for someone to come by and take my order, all the while I noticed 2 of them standing around, waiting for the other to react.  And just because a glass is on the counter half-empty, it does not mean you remove it without asking if it belongs to someone.  I really hope they take heed and address these issues somehow.  It's a great lounge space, but it could use some work.

7OfrRi-xGESQsBpJFrlfLA.review_text: enh...the decor is sort of nice with their woody exterior (rosewood..woody.  get it?  get it??  harrrrdy har har, i am such a comedic genius) but the space is small and the music was lame the night i was there.    there are only two unisex bathrooms and the light switch for both of them are outside the door.  I was in the midst of happily peeing when I was plunged into darkness by another patron who was accidentally leaning on the wall!

PLdNNcecADe4Mt9V9d9J4g.review_text: Came here for Jennifer M's bday. Bartender hooked it up, bouncer did his job, ambiance in the back room was fantastic, and it was dark enough to grope people and then casually dance away. My kind of party.

H08G-D5HVDl0rpGethUc8Q.review_text: really awesome place...good music and great crowd reminds me of my old hangout in cambridge: middlesexlounge.com

8pONVRF4HDD9ynt5lCynTQ.review_text: This is a 4-star bar in a neighborhood where most of the bars get 3 stars max from me. Why? The patrons are less drunk, less obnoxious, and less handsy than patrons at, say, Dragon Bar or 443. The bar staff is more cordial and professional than the barstaff at, say, Dragon Bar or 443. The douchebag quotient is significantly lower than you'll find just down the street, too. Maybe it's because Rosewood is a little further from the action of North Beach. I don't know...  What I do know is that there is limited but comfortable seating for the lucky few who get there early, there is a smoking patio out back where I can smoke to my heart's content, and they have bubbly by the glass. These things are all pluses in my book. The man says the drinks were a little pricey. I say I'm worth it and so is Rosewood. Nice, minimalist decor without any gimmicks (ahem, Dragon Bar), a large dance floor area, low sexy lighting, and dj's nightly, coupled with what appears to be a chill crowd and good bar staff makes Rosewood a place I'm likely to return to.

ksonr4xKjpmznXtf_rB2jg.review_text: It's Friday night and the weekends here  I need to unwindwith the party Mr DJ, DJ  I am ready to call my friends so we can boogie down with a party  heey heeeey Mr DJ  Hey Mr. DJ you can get this started,  Everybodys ready to party all night all night  all the girls are ready so we can all get to it,  so we can party till the break of dawn  Everybody move your body now do it Here is somethin thats gonna make you move and groove Hey DJ keep playin that song all night on and on and on....  ---  That was the mood last night as I shook my groove thang to many of Yelp's talented DJs.   Do you remember in Footloose how dancing was a sin? That's what was drilled in to me at the Southern Baptist school I attended in my youth. It's kinda funny to think how all my teachers must be turning over in their grave if they knew of my night at Rosewood.   The service was excellent considering how we filled the bar. There's a cool little atrium in the back where you can hang out and still hear the music while enjoying the fresh North Beach air. But in reality we all went outside to smoke cigarettes and cool off on the picnic bench.   There's a couple of parking lots/garages in the area, so we had no parking issues. Remember, these are cash only and by the hour. 4 hours or so is $12. If the parking gods are with you, you'll find street parking right in front.  The unisex bathrooms are a great idea! Although they could have used a little more... um..... paper towels. But that's ok. It all worked out. At the beginning of the night, it was so crowded that none of my friends noticed I wiped my freshly washed hands on them. By the end of the night, they were too faded to notice. Thank god there was TP. I don't know how I'd pull that one off.   Good times! Even better friends!

G6YyktEV8cPywmLSyOj0Ng.review_text: Yah private parties. Uh huh, right.  We rented out the back room and patio for my going away party plus 3 friends' birthdays. We booked the place with plenty of lead time and stayed in contact with the club to make sure we still had the space. We then proceeded to invite 100 of our closest friends.   The morning of the event the club calls us to say that they had double booked the back room but that there was nothing to worry about. They offered to waive the deposit and bar minimum. Uh. WHA?  We get to the club and it is packed to capacity. Not only had they double booked the back room. They had also booked the front space. Three big ass parties in a tiny club.  Good idea guys.   It was impossible to get drinks. People were turned away at the door. They were not allowed into the backroom where the rest of our party was. They ran out of mixers and alcohol. They had promised the other party 4 hours of their own music. (Even after they had told us that we could bring music.) You could barely hear the music on the dance floor or the backroom. They lost my friend's credit card.   Thanks Rosewood for jacking up my last party the Bay Area! How big is this club that you can't figure out that you overbooked the damn place.

Ui0A8-hrpEPuEUG8EGBNaw.review_text: On a Saturday, this place seemed like it could have been cool but it was totally not what we were looking for. The music was really bad -- poor choice of songs and bad transitions. This was strike two of the night of bad music. The interior is cool-looking: a smaller, much less pretentious relative of the all-wood interior at the Redwood Room.

ILz8ApVEgTqbv5LnC6PyuA.review_text: The location and convenience factor alone are enough for me to continue to frequent this place. The music is also a good reason. On the downside, the drinks are a little pricey, especially at $6 a beer. But hey, sometimes you gotta say what the $!@*...

8PB-hO5VwLY3pqJcZ9d9JQ.review_text: I researched and contacted over 10 bars for my BF's 30th before my friend recommended Rosewood.  I wasted my time with the other places because Rosewood was exactly what I was looking for!!  Toni was a complete doll to work with, she was always quick to respond to my emails/texts and she was so flexible. She accommodated every request and went above and beyond.  She even offered to pick up my BF's birthday cake! So sweet!   We reserved the front part of the bar with no minimum or fees.  We also got to bring in decorations/food and Tony made special drinks just for our party.  It's really a no brainer, if you want to host an event you should do it at Rosewood.  Toni also makes hands down the best drinks in SF.  All you have to do is tell her what you like and she'll make something totally unique and incredible for you!

dcxKyRz1QryZUrUnlWQfeQ.review_text: I was there for my school event who had rented out the bar. They had made special drinks for our event which where awesome! So good. My favorite part was the patio. It was a nice area with plenty of seating. I don't have anything really significant to say about it but that I was a nice venue for our group and I would probably go back.

-g3XIcCb2b-BD0QBCcq2Sw.review_text: Stopped in at Rosewood for a private birthday party last night and this bar's location and decor absolutely DOES NOT match where it's located.  From the street, this place looks like it's a quiet cocktail bar that's dimly lit.  False. This place opens up into the back with various areas set up with private parties with a small bar area.  The decor of this place is somewhat of a take on super trendy, Asian, and modern on the outside, but on the inside it's Prohibition-style with a dance floor. There wasn't a DJ, just a set speakers with music coming out of it in the patio area either.  Anyway, not a terrible place for a party, and we definitely had fun, so all of it just came off as "meh".

ixAzWY0pBHd-1P0gUPFcTw.review_text: If you are lucky enough to get in when its open, you are lucky.  It is a fun and fire-lit cozy meets chic bar.  And, Toni is the bomb.

NkVYcoaThHjOfTTgq6OdHQ.review_text: great little bar... i've been here tons of times and i still have a problem trying to find it! very hidden, but since only the locals really know about it, the crowd is usually good. i have to admit i didn't know about that outdoor patio... i always congregate towards the front. i'll have to check that out next time

kS1MQHYwIfD0462PE61IBw.review_text: feels like a meetup place--locals from work come together, friends hang out...can be crowded since it's just one side along a bar with no real flow, but also can clear out quickly.  so can be up or down.  unassuming entrance, ambiance is ok but not ultra.  low key, i.e. flip flops ok, no cover.

eyjhVMPb-jzshQVJ5YB-6g.review_text: Definitely gets crowded, and the dance floor gets crazy. If you like that sort of thing, you will love this place. Not such a good fit for me... and I'm still not completely clear on the need to charge a $5 cover. Nice wood paneling though- makes for a cool atmosphere.

XUEx8hrvhPd7vrzmSHbduw.review_text: My favorite bar in North Beach, so smooth. With the weather getting nice, make sure to check out their outside patio area.

TWhypn1bLKnkWUSm6MKDrQ.review_text: Nice decor....Awesome patio and private room for a party. But it was super crowded the night I went that I had to squeeze my way through the the bar to order a drink. After finally getting our drinks we were stuck standing in the middle trying to protect our drinks from spilling over. Yes it was that crowded. Overall I think the place is pretty.  I would go back for a drink someday.

l0uRV3nGEroXqsPypD4qdQ.review_text: Came here a couple weeks ago for Kim-Van T's birthday.  It was a cool looking place, with a good looking selection of beers on tap.  And the bartender definitely knew their biz, coming at me with the real deal Dark and Stormy's.  Much love and appreciation for those.  Music started really late.  Have you ever been to a bar/lounge where it's living room quiet?  It's really...bizarre.  It didn't last long, but I can't recall the last time I ran into that scenario.  Anyway, we were able to kick it, have some drinks, and relax.  Music was good when it was on.  I enjoyed it.  A good place with good drinks.  I don't frequent the neighborhood much, but I hope to stop by again.

jUFPpK5fASii8kOaSLHTPg.review_text: I held a surprise birthday party for my boyfriend here for 60+ people, and one of the biggest pieces of feedback I got from guests was how AMAZING the venue is. I could not agree more! For a very reasonable fee + extremely doable bar tab minimum, we were given a beautiful outdoor patio, our own bartender, our own dance floor/control of music, and a smaller indoor room to keep the cake/coats/etc.   Antonia was a pleasure to work with - she got as excited as I did about the party, and I really appreciated the smaller touches she put together (for example, stringing nice lights throughout the patio area, lighting candles all over, etc.). She also made a great effort to make sure the party remained a surprise, and work with us to make sure the party went exactly how we wanted it to. One of the biggest draws to the space was that we could choose five drinks to name after the guest of honor for our bartender to pour all night, which added a great touch (and they were pretty creative and tasty, too!).   This would have been five stars, except at some point in the night our bouncer (who was supposed to be keeping non-guests out and making sure the party remained private) ended up slacking on the job somehow. We started to notice a lot of people that no one knew on the patio, and had to get the manager/bouncer to ask them to leave. Minor snafu that was taken care of quickly, but still kind of annoying considering the party was supposed to be private!   All in all, I'd definitely recommend this spot to ANYONE looking to throw any kind of private/semi-private party in SF - such a fun and seamless night, and I hope to return soon!

bA6sFAZTIc5ddwpnB_WJUw.review_text: Nifty upscale but lowkey little bar on Broadway, halfway between the tunnel and the mad-ass intersection with Columbus.  As the name implies, there is a lot of wood here.  Some tables, a back dance room, a long, well-provisioned bar with a dj at the far end and a delicious and ever-evolving handmade signature drinks.  You have to know it's here, it's behind a heavy unmarked and barely lit door and even if you know exactly where it is, it's easy to miss.  Because it's on the Chinatown side of life  you can usually find street parking and you can mostly avoid the drunk drivers, boys causing trouble, aggressive cops, gangsters, muggers and panhandlers that plague the rest of North Beach.  Music varies with the DJ of course, there's a little dancing but overall it's a style I think of as tunes for white people to nod and shuffle by.  Also a Yelp favorite, so it's a good place to spot Yelp regulars.  There are many decent, cheap restaurants open late around here so it's a nice place to mix in with some good Italian or Chinese.

6QN6BdpcDKXNS9Xq_7pECQ.review_text: greg the owner and doug, the manager makes this place tick.  the queue for the pisser is a bit ridiculous though, hence more pissers please!

9rslkoEuINWodU8H0UNA6g.review_text: One of my best friends had her 25th birthday here. She reserved the back room, which was pretty awesome because we were able to use the back room + the patio all to ourselves. The decor was cute, she was able to name her own drinks with our own bartender, and have control of her own music as well. It was an all around fun night!  As we were leaving, I had forgotten my jacket inside by the back room. I went back in to get it to find that it was gone. Checked the front and it was gone. And then all of a sudden one of the bartenders came up to me and described my jacket and then she bolted out of the bar onto the street. A couple of minutes later, she came back with it!! Haha.. I was sooooo thankful! That would've bummed me out for the night so I really appreciated it!!

ra3OzaxpILytSjHRRKoT8g.review_text: A great place for an early cocktail with a group, even on a Friday, because it doesn't heat up until late!  Perfect for me.  I like to hang out with my friends, not scope a crazy crowd.

JNyAX0DHDIkVUCTinuevFw.review_text: For a private event, this place is awesome!  It does not look like much from the outside (almost walked by it had I not known the exact address), but once you get in, it has a great ambience.  They have several small cozy rooms, each with a different vibe.    I did not spend time in the front, as we had rented out the back.  Then there was a dark room that kind of had the feeling of a vampire movie.  In here was also a rack that you could hang your coat on.  No attendant, but it was nice that there was a place.  Right after that was the private party bar and a small dance floor.  The walls of that room were all white and they showed surfing movies on the wall.    The outside was the coolest part.  It was a small bamboo garden with sofas and a picnic table to relax in.  It felt like a true respite from the hustle of city life.    There was only one bartender for a private party, which stunk, but the prices were reasonable.  I definitely liked the vibe.

b1TLsiRhQdfbbXahqFkVtg.review_text: I don't know much about 'fancy bars' but I know what I like and I didn't like this place at all.  A few years ago a close friend would try and get me into this place every other week.  I went twice.... it was never good.  It wasn't even close to good.  The bartenders were totally inept, they took too long slapping each others asses and not enough time getting booze to the people waiting 3 deep at the bar. Also, why do the bar tenders need about 8 feet from the wall to the well?  Seems like the place wouldn't be packed nuts to butts if this was designed better.  Then there is the crowd of young people. Fine, I know, you are young... just get some act right.  Don't mean mug everyone that accidentally bumps into you... the place is packed, get used to it. Sorry, this place is too bad to discuss any more than this.

0V4Ra6jCmSAgFtCiORr4QA.review_text: I think Nish helped us crash a private party here.  (shhhh...)  LOVE the interior, love the drinks, laughed at whatever catering company hired the crazy sexy waiters and served up scrumptious bites to set the mood. Brilliant.  I couldn't help but chuckle underneath my breath when one of the model-esq waiters walked up and wanted us to eat his chocolate balls.  The platter was filled with hundreds of little battered marble sized chocolate balls.  Nice dessert if you ask me but unfortunately I did not feel the need to indulge.  *smirks*   I wonder how many I would have been able to fit in my mouth at one time.  "Chubby Bunny?" :o)  Not sure what a normal night it like here but really enjoyed the event.  Would definitely come back again!  Date Rating: 6 Pick up scale: N/A (not sure it was a private party doesn't count)  Strong Suggestions: I know it seems tempting but the weirder the drink sounds on the menu the stranger it tastes... stick to something basic the bartender seems to have a decent pour.

ZL4ozqMCOQs7sZO8aCcXTA.review_text: Where the fvck is this place! I walked by trying to find it.   Rosewood is like the pot of gold at the end of the rainbow. Except their is not leprachaun bouncer and it is a great find of a place. Dimly light lounge that serves up great drinks and has an even better crowd. Which seems to be nice transition from all the knuckleheads on Broadway.  Remember folks there is a back room! and to find this pot of gold:  It is located near the Broadway tunnel about two blocks as you go towards the intersection of Columbus and Broadway. Once you

s3kRi7b8t2sdtYcsMbqlJA.review_text: I came here last year and I enjoyed it better.    This time around the DJ played some funky mix's which I couldnt dance to at all.  I like the ambience, a little small for the dance floor and the cover was $5 for ladies and $10 for males?

KlC5BtqRxfRlY7OgTtPgoQ.review_text: A nice place to dance or just hang out with friends.  It's a hidden gem by being on the otherside Columbus so you don't have to worry about the crazy clubbers on Broadway.

ZbOK_2m4kifew3lzTep1yQ.review_text: Despite only having three beers, I managed to:  1. Dance until I had to warn people around me that I wasn't wearing deodorant. 2. Drunk dial a friend to ask them to come out, even though there was like, 20 minutes of the event left.  3. Bump into at LEAST three people and accidently make them spill their drinks all over me. It's ok, I don't waste. I licked that shit off (thank goodness it was only on my arm, that would have been awkward/difficult). 4. Meet some really cool friends of Emily X.'s from Seattle and danced with them the rest of the evening. 5. Drop half my pack on the ground because I opened it in the wrong direction. 6. "Give" OUT half my pack, you bastards!  7. Check out what was truly upstairs--nothing.  8. Met up with some really, really awesome friends 9. Made fun of JTF (---best part of night) 10. Went home with a smile on my face  Oh and it's not like it was awkward or anything, when I started squealing, that Beau started asking about Ana and Ria.   "Oh that was DEFINITELY Ana!"  5 stars for being a crazy person(s)

oAz4s21FA2QjE0kCNIDxOg.review_text: Excellent drinks, great atmosphere. That is, if you can find it! Glad that it's hidden though...it keeps some of the Broadway riff-raff out.

QRHS2i4DWS6R0fpkCalvaQ.review_text: Cute back patio and back bar that would be really adorable for private parties.

q0HDybhT0V9dXrs63_WqWQ.review_text: I'd bump them up a star if it were easy to find Rosewood. It took us about 2-3 minutes to find the place, and we were right across the street! Maybe that says more about us than it does about Rosewood, though. The doorman is cool. I mean like jazz and blues cool. Wearing a fedora, sun glasses, and just all-around smooth. The drinks are good, their beer selection is alright....meaning they admittedly have good variety but unfortunately I didn't really like any of the choices they offered. The DJ though (Satva?) I have to say was very good. He did a good job of keeping the crowd moving, and had my taste in good dance music (not prepared to share those to the public just yet). I liked the fact that there were a lot of people, however it wasn't packed to the point that I felt I was in a mosh pit. I like my space.

SEkY-jnn6FB8dCCl5lMhWQ.review_text: I don't have anything amazing to say about this place, but it had a classy vibe, no cover, and not too many sweaty people trying to cut between me and my friends on the dance floor. At the same time, there is nothing about it that would make me drag my ass out to North Beach just to go here. Gin and tonics are the same everywhere.

GfB6sC4NJQvSI2ewbQrDNA.review_text: A cool bar tucked away in the outskirts of North Beach.  I love the back patio.  It definitely has a cool vibe with the wooden walls.  Here's the link if you want to check out my photos from the Yelp party here last night: flickr.com/photos/maidel…

ioLQrCvCBz3HmlKZeFxbJQ.review_text: I'm not sure why other Yelpers keep describing the dark sexiness of this club. It was pretty dark, but not noticeably sexy to me. The stand-out of this bar is their ball-shaped speakers that hang down like disco balls.  The music was ok, not too dancey...lots of R&B. Pretty much no one was dancing. I noticed a long line to the restroom.  I did not try any drinks here, but really just stood around, so I can't rate the drinks. Unfortunately, I can't rate the attractiveness of the men or women either as I didn't check anyone out. Maybe that in itself is telling. There wasn't much seating, and the bar quickly became PACKED on a Saturday night. It was an arduous journey back outside to freedom...

ob0N8eC4293FUWljILXW-w.review_text: Whoa where did this place come from!?!?  I love the outdoor space and back area dance floor. we really got this place goin on fri night.. but mini size ipod sittin on the stool as the dj? i'm not sure what was goin on with that but nonetheless we had a great time dancing and chattin outside.  i'd def go back again, with a group of friends, as i think it would be boring and dead otherwise

WecuAsHBDZGj7Z6_sJcQAw.review_text: I had no idea I could like a North Beach bar this much.  Maybe it was the hidden entrance.  Or the swank and sophisticated interior.  Or the good beats.  Or the good conversation.  Or the party hosted by SF's premier foodie, the tablehopper.  Whatever it was, everything was working for Rosewood last night. I'd totally come back, and highly recommend.

kK996Gx3ZoR7Avd5WILFEg.review_text: Two things come to mind when someone says 'rosewood' to me:  1. A variety of wood commonly used in asian furniture and musical instruments  2. A town in central florida where mass lynchings took place in the 1920's.  I don't think of a small bar in north beach that looks kind of like a Design Within Reach showroom and has a decent sized dance floor, turntables behind the bar, a nice patio out back, comfortable seats and kind of pricy drinks. Maybe you do though though and that's ok because one ontology is as good as another as far as I'm concerned.  Oh, and the patio appears to have another secret bar connected to it. Does anyone know when that one is open?

P6HVUJ7VbFjYeAKtYPt38w.review_text: This place is in the cuts in china town. Didnt really recognize it, no lights inside just a huge metal door. walk in and the bar area is nice. The "dance floor" is pretty tiny but I see people workin it. ALL GOOD. you can walk out to the back patio and the place is very nice. We had a birthday party there and it was cool. The bouncer.. (only saw one) was super chill and nice.  -1 only two unisex bathroom stalls -1 only one bartender in the back so its a solid while to get drinks.

peXWpBYKrFs0h7HzFgkUTA.review_text: I heart this bar.  First, it's off the beaten path of North Beach so it's not too inundated with B&T.  Second, they have a great selection of draft beers.    But more importantly, as Vanessa G. noted, it's the best place in town to plan a party for 40-50 people.  For $200 and a reasonable bar minimum, you can rent out the back room and patio and have your own bartender.  And they actually enforce a guest list, so you can keep the gathering to your friends.  There are no hoops to jump through in making the reservation, and you can do everything over email.  This is a far cry from most venues in the city that hit you with BS fees and surcharges.  Our bartender, Aliza, was really accomodating and put up with my drunk ass, which says a lot.  All that said, I had my farewell party here last Friday and it went off without a hitch, and all my friends had a great time.  I took a shot of well vodka at 1am and that was not so great, but hey it's a great near-to-last memory of SF.  Docked one star because they said we could bring an ipod, but the speakers weren't working so we were stuck with whatever the DJ was spinning in the main room as opposed to the mix my buddy put together.

PqgrXIi2Mko8uAGQLp6Hsg.review_text: Interesting set up but in need of people.... This is a off the track interesting bar with a nice outside area... Would have never know of this place if it weren't for a friend's party.... We had the back room with the patio area to our group....  The rest of the place did look quite empty on a Friday night.... Not sure if the drinks are what's usually available on the menu or especially for the party.....  I guess I would only come here to host parties but it seem to be a bit empty for drinks and hang outs.....

h3KpLypa9SZEw2ydFNC19Q.review_text: 3/5 dope music  seems like a cool venue, though i was here for a backroom birthday event. there's a patio out there, and you can get a private bartender, and i believe you pay for the space, then the drinks are consumable against the bartender's time.  drinks were okay, always seemed to come out on the sweet side. the crowd i wasn't very thrilled to be around either...i get that we all want to unwind on a friday night, but your celebration shouldn't burden mine, and ladies, belligerence is never in style. take that to ke$ha or leave it at home with yo mama.   highlight though, was the dj. in the earlier hours he was playing all the right throwbacks! i was in north beach, but felt like it was LBC.

JE2pyEew6XtQxZojRNmbKA.review_text: I'm disappointed. I want to rate this place but I can't.   Courtesy of the extremely helpful Greg Lindgren, I set up a guestlist for Friday night. Granted, our list was 100+, so we had a fairly large crowd coming.   But as early as 10:30, I got a call saying that the bar was WAY too packed and there was no room to really move around. I was still at dinner at this point, handling the check slash hailing taxis to head over to Rosewood.   When we got the call, we moved our entire party to Medjool. We were told by the 20 people who had already made it to Rosewood that there wasn't even a DJ playing -- although I'm not sure if one showed up later that night.   I wanted so badly to love this place. Maybe I will go back one day without an entourage of 100+. I've heard such good things, the only downside is that it does get crowded pretty quickly on weekends. Which is to be expected when a bar is good.   So, just a warning to all though, it does get packed quickly. Maybe it's our own fault -- we were offered the opportunity to book the private room for $200 + $850 bar guarantee (it houses 40-80 people comfortably) but we declined that chance. Maybe if we'd just done that, we could have fit in a little more comfortably since our area would have been roped off for sure.   Oh well, there's always next time. Thanks anyhow, Greg! :)   3 Stars for now only because I'm a little bitter I had to relocate an entire party of 100+ when the bar hit max capacity as early as 10:30pm. I'm sure after I actually enjoy myself there, the rating will go up.

5iK4kSWPOKsB78s02S13fg.review_text: This place is awesome for private events since, for a reasonable deposit and minimum bar guarantee, you can have the entire private VIP bar and patio to yourself. None of that you only get x people on the list with bottle service junk here.   Especially during warm weather, it's the perfect combination of indoor and outdoor space. Ideally suited for around 100 people, there's a lounge room with couches, a private bar area and the patio that is accessible through sliding glass doors. The staff, from the bartender to the doorman, was super friendly too.   I would definitely recommend contacting Jon (one of the owners) the next time you want to plan a party! Rosewood is an upscale standout among the over-crowded generic club scene in North Beach.

J_ZY3YDkAVzEEYxvthozCw.review_text: Everyone here is extremely friendly.  Its a chill spot to grab drinks and start the night out.  The bartenders are amazing and shout out to TONI! She made a good night fantastic.

l26TgP9ox03XRLDuG-9wvA.review_text: Oh Rosewood. Where to begin? First of all, a big thank you, from the bottom of my heart, for putting up with me, my friends, and the Entourage that refuses to leave at 2a, even when you told us countless times you were closed. (I sincerely apologize- really!)  Rosewood is not what I think of when I think of North Beach. In fact, is this really even considered North Beach? I'm going to agree with my fellow Yelpers who addressed the layout of this place. The bar area is narrow and crammed, but beyond the bar lays a cute back patio, dance floor, and separate bar for private events. (At least I think this is the purpose of this bar- I don't know, I ventured back and forth between the two!) It's entirely possible to be in one place but have no idea where the rest of your group could possibly be. This place has the wackiest layout ever!  The bartenders and bouncer were nice enough- they don't particularly stand out to me, which could be a good thing, depending on how you look at it!  I do agree that they could use some additional bathrooms...as well as someone to make sure the inebriated men can figure out how to close a door. (Though this did make for a great photo!)  Not sure I'll be back, but I'll certainly remember you Rosewood!

QXAYZBYuZ1NbygFKvynnJQ.review_text: Came here for a birthday and it was  a nice venue.  Old school hip hop, somewhat good amount of seating, nice wooden walls and light structures. Bouncer was nowhere insight after 1130pm. There's a self help coat check and supplies scattered in the open counter, which can be used as a bar extension.   There was 2 or 3 bartenders moving as fast as they can. They all had the square so they didn't have to leave with your card to the cashier - very convenient. However, I had two very different drinks when different bartenders made them. Boo for inconsistency.  A lady bartender had the nerve to ask if it was okay that a piece of strawberry was in my drink?!? She then proceeded to say that it was in the ice bucket so it should be good. Are you kidding me?!? It's too difficult to make me a new, clean drink?!? DISGUSTED!   Besides this mishap, the venue was a decent discovery. I'd still come here but with caution.

qethMNVnmuHd1I4on52Hhw.review_text: I came here on a saturday night for a friend's birthday. Compared to the rest of north beach, this is a great choice if you want to stay away from obnoxious drunken maddness and just chill. They have an amazing drink: the mango gimlet...give it a whirl, you will not be disappointed...and the DJ played pretty fun tunes the majority of the night. It takes a lot to even get me to leave the mission on a weekend evening in the first place but I'm willing to put aside my skeptisim for other hoods when I encounter places like this.

8wNfJCqBYC_8xMDZjnMyuw.review_text: My experience here was for a good friend's wedding reception. I don't know what Rosewood is like at other times, as the wedding was my first!   That said, I would do a private event here in a heartbeat! The manager (I want to say Toni? I remember her like it was yesterday, but it was a GOOD party, so some details may be fuzzy) was A-MA-ZING. She took a vested personal interest in making the whole thing great, going well above and beyond the call of duty with details most venue managers would not even think of helping with.   Lovely space with lots of varied nooks and corners for a variety of moods and roaming. Beautiful with nice lighting. Solid drinks and all. Found it fine by the address and I liked that there was no super loud signage.

JnGtgOPpkjyWOvWM0SYEXg.review_text: a small bar/mini club...no sign out front....good for few drinks while bar hopping through north beach...a hit or miss..sometimes dead...sometimes packed....indoor seating...outdoor patio....wanting a small party?...private parties to be arranged at rosewood...

pRBzWnFzaCEtqhYyJ2ZTDQ.review_text: 5 stars for rosewood. -1 for it being in north beach.

rd7GDLBPC3dGMhV6Yk0otg.review_text: I had my birthday here this past weekend and it was absolutely perfect. The setup is great- big front room with couches and room to stand near the bar, then there's a dance area towards the back and also a cool outdoor/backroom area. It has a loungey feel but not super dressy. The best part was the staff. Toni the bartender reserved the front room for me and my group and also put together a list of drink specials customized for me. The DJ took our requests all night long and got everyone dancing. I had one of the best birthdays here thanks to them and definitely plan to go back soon! Highly recommend checking it out for a private event or just an average Saturday.

LkdQzmGlgR_7pr0gKWKZjQ.review_text: A fun place to hang out, listen to a pretty decent DJ, but getting through to the bar can be a drag. I send my little homies from out of town here to have a good time.  The dance floor is probably the best place to watch some drunken stylings and you best learn how to hold your bladder because the line to the can is a pain in the butt.  Park on Stockton Street and walk up, you shouldn't have a problem finding one on the south side of broadway.

23z4cqOIsR1umG0xCtPH8g.review_text: $18 for a jack and coke after paying a cover charge to get it.    Service was OK but given the price it was appalling.  Obviously there's a reason why I never knew this bar existed...

qPGhjScyxtuHrWXN4A8VXg.review_text: Contrary to the name, there is not a lot of wood here. The main wall appears to be wood, but it is an illusion. A farce, if you will.   The bar is wooden and the comfy (non-wood) stools have backs to them. I had a hard time deciding whether I preferred the stools to the lounge-y couch-things. I opted to half lean/half stand when I wasn't performing interpretive dance moves on the dance floor.   It's dim and cozy, providing just enough light to spot new people to hug, and cast a glittery shine on Dan's blingy-new necklace.   Decent selection of beers on tap and generous pours of Scotch.   Even though it didn't have the gobs of wood that I particularly enjoy, I still liked it.

G5LXEaxhQMF_BVjNHkVr7g.review_text: One of two bars I will willingly visit in North Beach, Rosewood is sleek without being pretentious. I've met people who have gone to this bar many times without realizing there is a back room and outdoor patio. Don't be one of those people.

OFi92Xc2QyIr787GNKtgZA.review_text: Had no idea this place existed, hidden behind all the fuss that's further down on Broadway and Columbus. Really enjoyed the decor, it's a great event space for those looking to hold a private party or a chill night out. The back outdoor patio is definitely the highlight of the place, with the bamboo pairing nicely with the chic modern decor. Reminded me of a smaller place you'd find in LA.  Can't say much for the sound system in the front room but it's certainly really loud in the back patio area, think it's escalated since the buildings surrounding Rosewood are all taller.  Friendly bartenders, I'd come back to grab a drink before the start of a crazy night.

EuuyiAuEa_s3VSS9i8okmg.review_text: Small bar, good times.  If you want a smallish bar to have a mellow but fun night, come here.  They have a small dance floor/room, but it's really small.  I enjoy coming here before going somewhere else.  It's a nice place to grab a drink and congregate with friends.  Pretty good drinks too, and cute-ish boy bartenders.  Crowd is interesting; a mixed crowd, but sometimes seems a little bridge and tunnel-ish.  I guess it depends on what night you go, and your frame of mind.

Rm0Jy8gbj5_zFs-SY5ZIkw.review_text: Toni is the best. Her Basil Gimlet is the best in this city! That's right, I'm looking at you, Rye!  In addition, the spot makes reasonably priced drinks and the bartenders know exactly what they're doing, unlike a lot of other places in this city.   There's a dance floor, PLUS I was extremely happy when the DJ was playing 90s RnB and hip-hop.   In addition, it makes a great space for bdays or other celebrations. :)

A5sEtzjzUWBVcr3w_pY2Mw.review_text:
I'm super sleepy and running on about 750 ml of expresso so I'm gonna make this quick...
  "Let's have a charity party on Tuesday!" Julio said.
  "Dude, no one's going to party on Tuesday.  It's a ridiculous day to party.  People work for a living." I said.
  "Rosewood is awesome, no one else will have a party on Tuesday, and think of the starving children, you selfish bastard!" Julio said.
  So with barely a week to spare, we went to work.  I gathered the power of Berkeley and Yelp, and Julio, the power of Stanford. (boooo)
  Yelpers are such party animals.  Everyone got their friends to come over and hang.  The eVite guest list swelled to 50, then 100, then 200 RSVPs.  Emboldened by this massive following, I was driven to invite every cool and attractive stranger I ran into.  I invited a Starbucks barista, three Brazilian girls I met at 111 Minna, and some chick I was chatting with in a hot tub.  I was hitting up party-friendly Yelpers I had never seen and telling them they had to come to this thing (Thanks Nirav and Anne Marie!)  The Brazilians made it, and the hot tub girl turned out to be Kelly E's friend.  Dude, the Yelp has eyes everywhere.  All witness its mighty outreach, yea.
  So I arrive at the place and prepare for the onslaught.  A steady stream of awesome company arrives and takes is position in the lounge, on the dance floor, at the bar, and in the candlelit Japanese garden yonder.  Mitch dutifully documents their fine looking selves as only Mitch can.  Everyone is having a good time, even if they do have to work the next day.  At night, never think of the morning.
  Wow, there are so many people here... I guess some people do like to party on a Tuesday after all.  Score one for Julio and Stanford.
  Greg was a trooper behind the bar, the guy obviously hasn't let the fact that he runs the place go to his head.  Service was effective and polite.
  It's an awesome venue, good folks run it, and it's remarkably accommodating for all sizes of groups.  I recommend it highly for those nights when your friends have dragged you out to North Beach and you're wondering where you can go to escape the tourists and bask in the loungey coolness.  Well look no further!

m-2lsMLw6H140wVhGCa-Tw.review_text: Good place, good music. Close to the usual Broadway spots but kind of a few blocks away. I think it's worth the walk if you have a group of friends and want something less dangerous.

0Cvgx6MKrSOTUxGoUpdaTg.review_text: Rosewood is usually my first stop when going down Broadway.  The times that I have been there it wasn't overly crowded.  A bit loud there so if you're wanting to just hang out and chat...ummmm...not a chance.  My favorite drink here is the Orange ROY-al...it's not on the menu and I had the bartender make it.  Since his name was Roy and it tasted like Orangina but there was absolutely nothing citrus in here...we named it the orange royal.  I had 2 of those one night on top of all the other drinks that I had I ended up pretty damn tipsy.  This place is kinda small but overall not too bad.

BGHdDra4uLCpIqTLOorNRw.review_text: This place is my favorite bar in the city. Its mellow but fun, the DJ's usually spinning some great hip-hop and the bartenders are cool and non-pretentious. Don't get scared off by the fact that it's in north beach. it's enough off the beaten path that it's usually just SF locals, not the raucous san jose crowd that takes over the rest of the neighborhood on saturday nights. It doesn't get going until late so it's best to roll in by 11 or so.

3yF53JSiDZNeA1qnSipkgg.review_text: by far my favorite place in the city. Great decor, good staff, and different ambients - including nice outdoor space. The music is also great, and when the crowd gets dancing, this place is unbeatable.

52O5yB6JxzqxssUy7qEtrA.review_text: I wound up here after waiting in line at a poorly organized club (Embarcadero Four?) for almost an hour in the safty weather on Saturday night.  The bouncers were polite in letting us in, and we waited for some of our other friends to show up, without too many stares at our diverse crowd in this otherwise pretty trendy, Caucasian bar. The bartender was nice, and my drink was appropriately drink-y. We snuck into the back room (which was apparently being rented out for a party, but nobody was using it, save this couple that was making out in the corner) and sat there to chill, and nobody from the bar bothered us or asked us to leave.  The bathrooms were relatively clean, and the vibe was nice. I was too cold to venture out onto the back patio, but from glancing out the door, it seemed nice and clean, and not too smoky, which is a welcome change from some of the other clubs/bars out there which have smoking areas cloaked in a haze of smoke.  I'd go back with friends, the music was pretty chill also. minus one star for the people hogging the lounge benches  in the main area.

qo8hQwnxnvY04rENn3gssg.review_text: This bar is pretty much hidden between Chinese restaurants in Chinatown...  From the pictures it looked like it has a good atmosphere and was quite cute! When I arrived I was in total chaos ... The bar was so full there was barely room to stand without being pushed along a sea of people.  The drinks are alright .. I just wish there was more room to breathe.

lV_lTwqdvBpp95SFO5yfbQ.review_text: Went here for a friend's going away thing on a Friday night. Forgot when we got there... maybe 11? 1130? And got in without a cover charge. Bouncer was nice. In fact my bf kind of snuck past behind him while he was checking our IDs and he didn't really mind haha. I started laughing really hard bc my bf is a little naive and doesn't go to bars/lounges/clubs much so he didn't realize they needed to check his ID and the bouncer simply asked, "why are you laughing at me??."  Plenty of seating. Crowded so a little hard to move through to get to the dance floor but I guess that means this place is happening. There is a back seating area and also an outdoor area and another bar/room outside. I liked the music a lot better out there, but I don't think it was a DJ. A lot of songs repeated haha. But it was much more to my preference--upbeat/dance music not hip hop like inside.  Didn't notice much else about this place but it was a good night ^^ I think at some point a line formed outside and they really regulating who came in or not, but don't know what was going on.  Would definitely come back and finding parking was easy.

w72KMWZ05NYbGh8MZQlUjg.review_text: Held my 30th Birthday here and I couldn't have asked for a better time!    Toni was amazing at helping coordinate everything. She helped the DJ set up, the photo booth and cake. When I got there everything was ready and set.   All my guests enjoyed themselves, I woke up to numerous texts saying how much fun they had!!  Thanks to Toni and the Rosewood staff for such a great time!

-pvKGlb04e8brYqsXGteQw.review_text: Ah, Rosewood; So easily confused with plot elements from Orson Welles films, yet so very different in character. Welles was a man to stand alone, to take a stand... but in Rosewood one can never stand alone. One can only stand in a crowd.
