In fact, it's less like you're standing, and more like you're suspended in the crowd and a moved around BY them rather than of your own accord...  The music is good, but you're never more than a part of the crowd here. Maybe I'll come back some day when trashed :-)

HAu5OgbkLGsmLhKBJ2RR1g.review_text: My friend decided to celebrate his birthday at Rosewood for a few reasons - diverse crowd and non EDM music.  Sounds good to me.  The bar is pretty small.  When you walk in, theres the bar on the left and seating areas on the right.  The walkway in the middle was packed.  In the back, there was a small dancefloor.  Half of the dance floor is occupied with people waiting for the bathroom.  There's also a patio area in the back with a smaller bar.  The bar service is EXTREMELY slow.  I think there was one bartender working it?  EXTREMELY SLOW.  But, she was really nice.  Many of us got free drinks from her.  SCORE!  BUT REALLY, SO SLOW.    The crowd was not really that diverse - perhaps its because my friend's birthday brought in 30+ Asian kids?  Probably not like that normally?  No clue.    The bathroom line was impossible.  There's 2 stalls for everyone.  And the inside was disgusting.  But if you gotta go, you gotta go.  Overall, this is a good place to hang out.  No cover.  Just casual and fun :)

in68cnbJN1AQ6FMpuloXXA.review_text: I have been trying every day for over a week to reach this lounge to plan a large party, yet the number posted here isn't working, and I have emailed then event email listed on the website now 4 times without a response :(. Given that my hopeful birthday party was supposed to be next month, I'm quite disappointed... Anyone else know how contact this venue???

dh2fVHvb9EC9uJVjD2_DCA.review_text: This is to specifically review Rosewood as a place for private events.   I recommend Rosewood Bar very highly for private events. I just hosted a surprise party for my husband, and everyone at the party was really impressed by the private party space (which for my party included the entire outdoor patio space), the bartender and the rest of the staff. Several of my friends told me that they would definitely consider using Rosewood Bar for their future events.   The manager of the place, Doug, is very cool and very accommodating - during the planning stages he was available in the afternoons for walk-throughs for me and for my friend who was helping me decorate and during the evening he really helped with keeping track of the bar bill, helping with the AV, helping with clean up and making sure everything was OK.   My party had about 50 people at the peak time, and there was PLENTY of room including room for people to dance. You could probably go as high as 70 people without too much crowding.   The price was reasonable for such a great space and they did not throw in any extra fees or charges even though we had the sole use of a bartender and a door guy.   They were really good people and definitely contributed to the overall success of my party!

lpAM2-TTc4I_vB-hedQgWA.review_text: It was my boyfriend's 28th birthday...the night was young and our bellies were full...  A group of us, 5 couples, went to Rosewood by recommendation of one of our fellow homies.   Guess what? It was a great spot! It was a Friday night, about 11:30 pm and it was not packed. We were able to get a table while the guys hung out at the bar.  The best part - Great music - from N.E.R.D to Common to Mos Def...great lounging hits!!!  We will return!

2p6iEFExhzppPDr7UDWS7w.review_text: to me, rosewood's been a bit like the pair of ferragamo loafers i bought in italy.  first time i wore them, walking through the streets of venice, i got a blister. if you've ever been to venice, you know that's the last place in the world you want to get a blister.  as for rosewood, first time there everything about it rubbed me the wrong way - impossible to find, impossible to find parking, packed to the gills, hotter than crap inside, hard to get drinks.  second time i wore them in vegas, i swapped out the inserts, and they felt much much better.  no blisters after a night of partying and walking up and down the strip.  second time at rosewood, it's still packed and hot as hell, but the vibe is good.  i guess when your friends are having fun it's hard not to have a good time as well (unless you're the debbie downer of the group but just don't know it yet).  third time was this past saturday night, wearing said loafters at rosewood. i had a great time, as did all of my friends.  we discovered that if you sit your attractive girlfriend (or date) at the bar when a seat opens up, the drink flow is steady and hassle-free.  by now the shoes fit me like a pair of loafers should - and so did rosewood.    i guess it just took a little bit of breaking in.

mROok9JZx19AwvOJlI8FHQ.review_text: I've been to Rosewood about a half dozen times now (most of the them for the Yelp DJ Events) and I've had fun on each visit.   The modern decor, patio, and extra rooms in the back make for a lively place to have drinks, mingle, and dance.   The sound system was able to accommodate all the different types of music that I've heard too.  One star taken off for the pricey drinks but overall, a great place to have fun if you're on the Chinatown/North Beach border.

DiCBpb_hyNy2150fGAbEug.review_text: Rosewood was the very first bar I went to when I moved to the city. I literally jumped off the plane, my fellow Texas girlfriend picked me up, and drove me to Rosewood where I had my first drink as an SF immigrant. For a while, this place became the Wednesday night hangout for my friends and I, until it gort"discovered" by a sheeshier crowd. Nonetheless, the Wood has been able to maintain it's underground vibe, that allows me to sip to decent drinks and dance to its fun old school hip hop beats.  Me likey!

KQcGQ_djMNa1t0OLkQseKw.review_text: Rosewood, where did you go?  You used to be my favorite place in the city but now so empty.  Everyone, go to this bar!  There's couches, good drinks, great hip hop, and a dance floor that's perfect size for a fun night with friends.  There's even a back room for private parties.  Bring back the fun!

GmN6Qwo9aK803f7PLH6dVw.review_text: Oh wow, what fun! Even though there was a party that packed the whole place it was a blast. Music, a little interesting at times, but for the most part was good. Dance floor! Woo! Sleek look but cozy too. Would certainly come back.

uZKLg2RRJfAbKFo_hldn6g.review_text: I've never been a big fan of anything on Broadway as a place to hit up at night so I was surprised to find such a cool place here.  The decor is on the nicer side for the area with a random little dj booth set up right next to the bar.  Theres also a back area that you can dance in if you feel like gettin your groove on. Unfortunately, it takes a while to get a drink here; it seems as though theres only one guy who pours beer and another bartender who actually makes drinks (although she was sweet enough to give me all of my drinks on the house because I waited  a while.)  Aside from the skeezies who decided to follow me around all night, Id have to say that this is a pretty decent place if you're looking for a nice laid back spot in North Beach.  But ladies, be forewarned, this is not a very big space and duck and hide tactics don't work very well here.

M9PmJw0TBs4cueJp75dvGw.review_text: Came here again recently for an annual party.   My experience was great because of the: a. fun people b. photobooth c. free food & grey goose cosmos (holler.)  I STILL have yet to come on a normal day, but Rosewood seems to have kind of a weird feel.... Feels like it's someone's old flat (main room in front, kitchen & bedroom in back.)  Bartenders were talented but not as friendly as the last time I was there.  Great venue for hosting a party but it does seem a bit "cold."

JNyLyXn-unUhJmiGJnI6tQ.review_text: Rosewood was my New Year's Eve destination, in part because my friends were going (lemming!), in part because of the cool space, with outdoor patio, and in part because of its proximity to the Broadway Tunnel (a favorite late night walking route of mine--so safe and sanitary).    Having witnessed much of the party planning preparations, I was well aware that the owner and staff were exceedingly easy to work with.  The night of, they proved themselves just as friendly and festive, going above and beyond our expectations.

NU9DwKAg9SShW9jIy2AnfA.review_text: Bad idea #1 - going on a Saturday night.  Bad idea #2 - not having a back-up place in case there was someone holding a birthday party there (there was.)  Bad idea #3 - Going with a (scattered) group of 30+ people.   Basically what I'm trying to say is that Rosewood's a bit on the small side. Sure there's a dance room in the back...but if you're going there to get some drinks and chill, there's not enough space for you to just stand somewhere and not get squished and/or pushed around. I made countless 360 degrees turns because people around me were trying to go in different directions and trying to not spell liquor on other people.   On the upside, the drinks were pretty good. Decently priced, a bit on the expensive side. Bartenders are fast and efficient, but you can't escape the wait since there's ten other people telling one bartender what they want. They also allow you to use credit card / and open a tab, which made paying easier.   I would be open to try this place again, probably on a weekday night, and see how that goes. :)

BrgUPuFlkmt_r6vMSvn2hA.review_text: This place is a hidden gem!  I had the chance to host many great company events here and the venue is aazing. Especially loveee loveee their patio area :)  The staff is very friendly, Kudos to Antonia! They are very helpful, hardworking and look happy all the time. I love Rosewood Bar and everyone should definitely check it out!

5Ap91V6vM4wgxgJeCu68-Q.review_text: The bar is pretty small, but there's this nice little intimate seating area outside, in the back. If it hadn't been so cold that night, I probably would have enjoyed it more...   Rosewood is more of a really really relaxed bar in a convenient location. Not a see and be seen place...

8ozxJndeMSqObxZc4xDsbg.review_text: I really like this place, but what's up with the timings?    I've been here once before for a private party, it's a cute spot with an outdoor patio in the back. A lot cuter than the divey North Beach bars.  But every time I've been here since, it looks like its being renovated or it's not open for some reason.  I recently tried to go here Saturday evening, I checked the website, and it said it's open at 5pm on Saturdays (considering they do have a patio, they should be open during the day, SF is known for day drinking)...When I got here at 6:30PM, they were still getting ready for the night.  The guy cleaning asked me to come in 30 mins, and I reminded him that the website said 5PM, and he said no we are not ready.  I mean c'mon!  I recommend calling before you go.

dim5Svrt-B1jvvQsOIX22A.review_text: This place is really cool (yes, lame intro) and I think it's kind of a hidden gem among the crappy looking Chinese restaraunts on Broadway and I think its the perfect venue for closing out your Friday/Saturday night if you live in the vicinity.  Nick H. warned me about the bouncer who is a real smartass so most of the reason that I would come back is to annoy him and so that he would be forced to give me more than a C+ for my comebacks.  They play hip hop and some hip hop holla backs, which definitely put me in the mood to shake my bootay...but I was really afrraid that the bouncer would tell me that I dance like a typical white girl.  So I didn't dance...one of these weekend nights I'll work up the courage...

ELc2M96tMEomAhPz23zH9w.review_text: I can't believe that we missed the patio!  We did get the awesome seat by the window though.  Great drinks and not too crowded on a Saturday night.

KB6gQqzPVtHBcD40wf09pg.review_text: I attended a private party on Saturday night for my friend Glynis M who will be embarking on a new chapter of life in London later this year, lucky lady. My friend and I could hardly find the place as we walked up from a birthday party we attended at Kell's. It's super incognito, and the street is pretty dark, but the bouncer was friendly and showed us where the party was.  The bar itself was pretty standard, and I've actually been there before but I didn't realzie they had a backyard area that could be pimped out to look super classy. Gold string lights, plants, wood benches, and a private bar with Glynis-themed cocktails were among the amenitites. It didn't hurt that a ton of friends were there too. Really a nice spot, I hope to be back soon, but management should consider some signage or lights on the dark street in front so people can actually find it.

2l0O1EI1m0yWjFo2zSt71w.review_text: Pretty sweet space in a convenient location.  I really liked the bar in the back but I got kicked out (more like not let back in even though my friend just started a tab back there).  The vibe in the back was super mellow and would serve as a good venue for an intimate gathering of friends (for drinking purposes).

w1GTxc6VqJTG57tpO8ZoxA.review_text: i attended a private party here. The private room leads to the patio and the back patio is super cute. The place is tucked in between a bunch of visually unappealling stores.  it was hard to find.

9CWr1HukCWdjW-5zTCXVIA.review_text: The place is just as fabulous as our very fabulous Angelo. The back room - guarded by a bouncer - had just enough space to fit in his many friends, but still look full.  The bar tender was great and the music was a mix of that horrible popular stuff that you (ok...Joyita and I) can't help dancing to.

-revik7E7JG7umKzU_OLAA.review_text: Pretty cool place.. i would give it 5 stars.. but the lack of space makes me feel claustrophopbic...  In the end the bar peeps are friendly.. and if there exist a drink.. you can slurp it up here.  I will have to say though i give props to the boys outside.. when its past midnight.. just tell them you want to go in to drink it up.. and they will probably let you in..  It also helps to have some hot chicks on your arm as well!!

6barujjst79kB-Jsg9092g.review_text: literally a watering hole with really loud music...if you drove by it, you'd probably miss this tiny sign.  i've only been really late in the evenings, so can't attest to a whole night experience there...but i'd go back.

khFA0eLpu7H08JOWtiVF8w.review_text: Yeah, I've been giving a lot of 5-star reviews lately...but I guess things have just been good for awhile. Thanks to Yelp, I stay away from the crappy places and only frequent the good! This is the power of the INTERNET! Thanks Al!   Anyhoo, I'm a little late writing my review of Rosewood after the DJ Battlefield Earth event organized by douchebag numero uno, Jing Tao Fuckface aka JT F. But...  Quite honestly...I love you all.  This was so much fun - such great music, such ridiculous fun on the dancefloor. Rachel, Karen, Sammy, AJ, Omid, Graceypoo...you all can DANCE! And everyone else I forgot...please forgive me, not surprisingly, I was drinking. I loved the layout of this place - as Steph was saying, there are all these different zones. It really made for a great experience and I am definitely planning on going back and checking it out on a regular night.   Sadly, they ran out of grapefruit juice by the end of the night, but that's not very surprising considering the disproportionate love of Greyhounds among the crowd present.   Also, thanks so much to Greg at Rosewood for letting us take over and being so gracious about it.

Fo4dF9tzghnMBCTm_8W-Jg.review_text: I didn't really see too much of this place since I just stopped in with Rob and Angelo for a minute before closing on Saturday, but it seemed nice enough. I hear the best part is the patio out back, but when we tried to head back there we were told it's only open for private parties, which was lame.   They did have a cool little dance floor and non-bottle-required tables and benches you could sit at which I always appreciate. It shouldn't cost me 400$ and up to have a seat at your drinking establishment.   I hear the back is really where it's at, so hopefully I'll see it someday.

BKxQJJAh_0Jtv4MqxbjkMA.review_text: I went to a super fun private party in the back room here last Friday.  I was impressed by the place.  The front bar was really nice with a warm modern wood decor.  I didn't pause to enjoy the scene there but as I passed through the music was fun and the crowd seemed to have dressed up for the night.  The party in the back was great.  Super packed with some dancing here and there and a chill patio scene.  The bouncer watching the list at the private party door was nice and mellow and didn't have any problem recognizing us as we came and went.  I'd go back, private party or not.

HC3cKhfMkHFSDe8L9Y7UsA.review_text: Rosewood is an amazing venue for private parties. Toni who helped us plan the event was amazing! We even got to name our own drinks. I loved the layout, there is plenty of room on the dance floor and the outside patio is a nice place to take a break.   The only reason the place gets 4 rather than 5 stars is the DJ. The DJ was supposed to have top 40, but I don't know what he was playing. I tired to make requests for popular songs and he didn't have the music requests I wanted : (

GpXHZzZXfAL6u6beIC0cIA.review_text: I love the new addition to the back room. They have a really nice outdoor patio now. well... it's not really "new", but newer compared to the rest of the place. Fav night to go is Wednesday. They play a great variety of euro hip hop and underground us hiphop. Great crowd, very eclectic. totally different from the rest of North Beach. Wish that they had more space to dance, but it's really beautiful inside. The back room can be rented out at a reasonable price too for private parties. complete with your own bouncer too :)

hVY5dJtw_B3zdAYN4V7I0A.review_text: I've never been able to figure out why, but I've been to bars in the Castro with a better female to male ratio than Rosewood.

0nwGxhxTX_1l0zchn5PBJw.review_text: Two beers.  I said I would drink only two beers.  TWO!  But inside Rosewood, with chatty Yelpers everywhere, Bill's bad ass platters spinning beats that bounce around the room like superballs, Jaime's bajingo in the house . . . somehow it becomes impossible to perform basic math.   "ok - so, I've now had 3 beers in the first 60 minutes, so if I am planning to have only two beers while at Rosewood, I had better start catching up!  Bartender!"  2 hours, 5 beers, and I bowled like a stud last night.  Sadly, I missed the dancing.  Next time.  As for the place - nice bar, nice patio, snappy bartenders, no complaints.  5 stars.

VOlSQPbMKt8OTbRYrFyJYw.review_text: Underrated - my buddy Julio throws great parties there.

zpWizDgUk4-rQJXdjiBY1w.review_text: Private party here? YES PLEASE!!  WOW, what an amazing experience at the Rosewood. I held my 25th birthday here and Toni, the event coordinator/bar manager, worked with us to reserve the front part of the bar for my party. For my semi-private party, we were allowed to customize the drinks with ingredients and names, control the music via Spotify, and provide my guests with a passcode to get into the event to ensure we had a closed guest list. This place has a dance floor and a pretty decent amount of seating if you feel like chilling on the side. Also although the guests from the other party had to walk through our party, I didn't feel like the guests from the other party invaded our event too much - or maybe they just blended well and I didn't notice! We had ~40 guests, and the place didn't feel crowded at all.   You're also allowed to bring in your own food! That's a pretty sweet deal.   If you're looking for a venue that isn't overly priced and has great service, look no further! The only caveat is that my friends had to taxi or drive to the location, but at least it prevented a lot of them from leaving before 12:30am, when the party was just getting started!  Kudos to the bar tender who immediately handed a towel to me when a drink spilled on the entire back of my dress.  Five stars for this location/bar, I would definitely recommend this place for future events.

NpU44ANnUUNQWY4U0eUGvA.review_text: not a bad place to hang out for drinks.  a dancefloor in the back.  never been on the patio.  can get crowded.  music is good.  long bathroom lines though.  no cover.  is far away from all other northbeach bars.  but close to sip.  and yuet lee.

zpip_kWCOda43ZCWk0BFmQ.review_text: Looking through the reviews - it is no surprise that most people who gave Rosewood 4-star or 5-star reviews held an event in the back patio.  Every time I've gone to Rosewood, the back patio is being used for a private party. I've come to just expect that from Rosewood and this is quite disappointing.  Pluses: - Friendly staff - GREAT music (they will also change it to what you request if you ask nicely) - Fun dance bar/dancing space - Variety of drinks - Close to other bars and late night food (Golden Boy)  Minuses: - Back patio is basically not open to the public because there are always events going on  - The front of the place also gets used for private parties sometimes, which puts non-private party people somewhere in the middle  I want to go back but only if I can access the back patio - please Rosewood?

vjLPc9nYPkZNLX4ulBeTCg.review_text: Good music, cool crowd, & fun night!

A6cnSgLx01w67iJweLjmuw.review_text: I like this place. I haven't had a bad experience the few times I've been here.  Drinks are good. Staff is good. Parking, haven't had trouble.  Also, it's close to golden boy pizza. :)

FKyQWTe-yrm1tRTRveurkA.review_text: Cute little bar nestled in Chinatown with an unassuming back room for private parties.  Actually really really cute, with a nice outdoor patio as well.  It's pretty chill but later the girls and dudes dressed to the nines roll in and scoff at you in your cute tee, ripped jeans, and chucks...wth, I'm stylin' too!  Whatever, sit there drink a beer or a cocktail, chat with the people that stop in, it's all good in the 'hood (of chinatown! ;D)  drinks were okay, but the ambiance was nice, I would come here again for the sheer fact that a homeboy lives across the way! :)  And because I had fun with my friends here! :)

QxPxxPjgcQ-MDM6OMYMFCg.review_text: Thoughts running through my head at Rosewood last night.  - Where the hell is it?  It can't be INSIDE the Broadway Tunnel. - Oh here it is, the place is so unmarked.  That's okay, keeps out the riff raff. - It's fireplace orange and brown inside.  So warm and home-y, just the way I like it. - Hey, the light fixtures look like martini olives.  Martini, yes, drink, yes. - Ooh, the bar stool is pretty comfy. - Yes, Roy, the bartender with the Irish (no, not Scottish) accent is making my drink good and strong. - It's only 9pm and not crowded yet.  I think I need to walk around, check out the place. - Hey, nice wine display in front of the dance floor.  This place isn't just for hard stiff drinks. - Hmm, it says private party.  You know I'm New Yorker nosy.  It won't matter if I take a little peek.  Hey, it's a cool little space in the back. - Okay, I should get back to our little group.  I'm already dizzy. - Why is that dude wearing shades in here?  He says he's from Brooklyn.  Correct me.  He said he was only born in Brooklyn.  There is a difference. - Thirsty thirsty.  I need another one. - And another one. - And another one. - Happy.

G9Vb6yQ047TC3O_-GG4WZA.review_text: One of my favorite bars in North Beach to lounge at and have a couple lychee martinis. When I used to live nearby, I'd come here pretty often because it's pretty hidden on the far end of Broadway, so not many people knew about it. I really like the small space, and it's great for private parties. When you're with friends dancing on the small dance floor or squeezing into the little couches with each other, it's a lot more fun. You'll probably want to ask your own DJ friends to spin too.

b0lXNnfnZpKPv7xNwpG3Ig.review_text: It's a nice little lounge on the border of Chinatown/NorthBeach.  11PM on a Saturday night and no bouncer and no cover...score!  Only minus was the bartender didn't know what a Woohoo was and we ended up having cough medicine shots.

4BEsDcvJZf0reK3yQdgu5Q.review_text: I researched and contracted ovet ten bar for my girl friend's 30th before I was in the recommendation as the rosewood. Toni was a complete doll to work with this and at the time she is so quick to respond you and here all you have to do is tell her what you like and she will make something totally as the unique one to me.

ZtmeHAQyNFku338dJMIfTg.review_text: 3 stars with the potential to grow.  Went here for the first time and unfortunately didn't feel the love that most others here did.  When I walked in at around 11:00 on a Friday night I was one of three people in the whole place.  I was meeting up with a big group and oddly enough when they showed up, so did about 20 other people.  So it did crowd up rather quickly but it was an odd crowd regardless.  Quality over quantity I always say.  Drinks were ok, not that strong and average priced.  The music was nothing to yelp about.  The ambiance was actually great, perhaps one of my favorite "looking" and "feeling" bars in North Beach, even though this place really is in Chinatown...   I'll give it another chance sometime but until then I'm stuck at 3 stars.  P.S. I had no idea there was a patio, will definitely have to check that out next time.

zpb17M4OG4Agjn3dK32CEw.review_text: Dick bouncer lecturing me about bringing a backpack into a bar. So I'm supposed to go halfway across the city to leave it at home? It would be a 2 star loss just for that if he hadn't let me in. Just -1 star for the lecture. But that mojito was pretty bad. I ordered a mojito because I have been drinking all day and needed a light drink. It was simple syrup w/ a splash of soda instead of the other way around. Way too sweet -1 star.   What happened to this place? I remember when I would consider having another private event here but the quality of customer has fallen off a cliff. The first thing greeting me is a dumb-ass at the door accusing me of tagging up the bathroom w/ sharpies in my bag? STFU

UnvwodJKxqXn6Bhhcm1Amg.review_text: This place has a great vibe, an outdoor patio, fun music/dj, and friendly bartenders and bouncers...you can either just hang out and chat with friends over drinks, or go wild on the dance floor.  It's hidden away in between a few chinese stores and restaurants.   Apparently, you can rent out the back room for a private party, and have access to the back outdoor area.  The owner was kind enough to open up the place when it was closed so I could get my jacket that I had left there!

bkT1wsuQkOyOVk0eOFM_8Q.review_text: It seems as though years ago, rosewood was hot, then not, and now over the past year or so, it seems like it is hot again.  The parties have generally been fun, the place loud and cramped, the crowd sometimes too "marina" sometimes not...just depends.  Anyway, my most recent experience there was great as far as company goes and just decent as far as service.  I have a little bit of a hard time with places that have a capacity for 200 people only having 2  bathrooms (meaning stalls) in the entire establishment.    The service, just average....I had to wait 10 minutes in an empty bar (I got there early) for a drink.  Overall, had a great time, until I HAD to leave because I was getting harassed by a friend of a friend...in this case persistence only led to annoyance.....def did not pay off.

aVaa64zb_-d6VTY3XcXyIQ.review_text: I've been here a few times before we start our drunk rendevous bar hopping on Broadway. I love the atmosphere of this place, dark, sexie, and cute. The music and drinks are always a nice add on when kicking back here with friends.

tbYCj_yUXd0kjdipFJs2iA.review_text: Nice little break from the madness that can be North Beach. Enjoy it because the DJ (most of the time) will spin hiphop- but the speaker system needs to be upgraded for a better effect. It doesn't get crowded until later on in the night (11-12am), but when it does, good luck trying to get a drink!

iKgxE370H8mjNpCITtXujw.review_text: Hey All you Rosewood fans check out this funny video which involves an escaped Alcatraz prisoner who ends up at Rosewood. Created by Rosewood's DJ Satva and Thomas Mich: Escape to the Barbary Coast youtube.com/watch?v=yvSk…

nqb5kKa4nHQtVq6zQZtnxg.review_text: This place sucks! I went here because everyone raved about this place, but the DJs can't mix beats, the sound was terrible with cheap speakers blaring in one corner, the bar was crowded w/people just standing around, the bathroom lines were long, and the dance floor was wet and sticky! I know the Peninsula peeps might go down to NB's main strip, but damn this place was filled with people who thought they were too cool for school. I'd rather go hang out elsewhere where the DJs can spin and the crowd acts like they're having fun!

ChKHMb5xCCjO99vac3MhnQ.review_text: The perfect blend of good music, flavorful drinks, plenty of seating, and booty everywhere (i mean, dancing).  Really good staff and I had no idea but there is a private room in the back that is pretty spacious with private bar.  I really hope this place never gets too trendy.

i8L_pnkXcJQ8VyApK_3_mw.review_text: Went for the Yelp DJ event 3 The Hard Way.  Cool spot and nice layout.  I liked that it was dimly lit with candles lining the bar and lounge tables.  A nice comfortable bar you can hit up after work and not worry about it being too packed.    There was open space for what seemed like dancing but im not sure i would come here to dance.  Although when Aaron I. played Debbie Gibson, i admit, i got off my stool wanting to bring it back to the 80s, but refrained and instead just smiled and bobbed my head.  Him and AJ did an awesome job at playing good tunes.  I really liked the outdoor patio with the bamboo surrounding.  It made me want to smoke though.  Damn.   The bartender/owner was extremely nice.  When i didn't like a drink i ordered he gladly replaced it with another, no charge.  He also made a special drink a couple friends of mine had that i wanted to try but didnt get to.  Special thanks to JT for buying my first round.  Arigato my friend!  Guess i'll have to come back to see what special concoction the bartender came up with.

jkr3YVCEoRNKkxinUZpW6A.review_text: This was my second visit to Rosewood, and I'm still none the impressed.    The back area seems cool for hosting a party, or so I've heard...I haven't been able to see since it's always been reserved.  So what about the rest of us?  There really needs to be more seating up front.  And more bartenders would be great too- people in my group waited forever to get drinks.  And I didn't even get a drink, thanks to the solo bartender on a Saturday night.  Maybe that's why I left so grumpy.    +3 for the awesome dj spinning behind the bar.

1dW1kLdcKuQprnhi4pC_iQ.review_text: Wow, its been here for 10yrs already...1st time for me. Great layout, outside patio is fantastic. Great Dj spinning the night we were here. Drinks prices are average for the area, besure and tip your bartenders folks!! :-)

sRVGewx--HgwwlKwAfCO9Q.review_text: I tend to like cool bars in unusual places.  Rosewood resides on a pretty colorless part of the Chinatown/North Beach merge, and you could easily miss it if you didn't know where to look.  The decor is masculine, clean & modern with an really nice back room that is great for private parties.  I attended a Christmas party here a couple of years ago that was oh so much fun, and the indoor/outdoor aspect of the space was nice.  The layout goes front room/bathroom hallway/sharp right/back room - easy to miss if you're not paying attention. It's almost like having two bars in one - no complaints here!  Good cocktails, good service.  Friendly staff that held on to my suede jacket for almost a month when I left it there after previously mentioned Christmas party.  Recent night out here left me in a euphoric blur - after recovery, I will be back again.  Update 12/06:  Attended another Christmas party here, and I have to say, it is one of the best private-party venues in the city.  The staff is accomodating, the space is big enough but still personal, and the 2 rooms plus the outdoor area makes it feel like you're at someone's home.  Someone's home with a bar staff.  Kudos to this bar, once again.

Rx7DNBmPPShVjlcQidGuTw.review_text: one of the more laid back places to grab a drink in n. beach.  you can avoid the under 25 crowd here.

BMALCmkPgIbqAXzqxhRvLQ.review_text: So I just had an event over the weekend on a friday night and it was absolutely amazing! Amazing venue, amazing staff and big kudos to Toni who I think is the GM but helped me plan out the event.  I had my 30th private party there.  I used the back rooms including the patio.  The patio has beautiful lights decorated around and they also light up tea lights around the space so it really sets the ambiance.  I had a 1920's theme and it worked out perfect with the venue.  You can use their dvd projector so i had b&w pictures of the '20's playing.  They also have an ipod hookup so I had jazz playing.  You have your own personal bartender which is awesome.  There was no rental fee but you did need to meet the bar minimum.   Toni was so helpful!! She created a 1920's cocktail menu for me.  She reminds me of a wedding planner that is always at your side.  She returns my calls/emails. Seriously funny and so much fun.  So overall, highly recommend this place.  It's very private perfect for parties which means you won't be having people that you don't know in your private space.  You really have control of the event.  Dopest place. People had so much fun and this place was getting really good hits from my guests.  THANK YOU TO THE STAFF AT ROSEWOOD AND ESP TONI!!! Really made my 30th memorable!

W9PUOzPRRXqSrN-sBEZogA.review_text: Generally laid-back, good drinks. There's a DJ (or at least a guy with a laptop and a good itunes library) jammed in the corner, and an open space big enough to be used as a dance floor. The back patio area is what sets Rosewood apart from other bars; it's a quiet little oasis where you can actually have a conversation.   I've noticed that Rosewood has a very odd density distribution: there's usually a huge area in the front that's completely empty, then a cramped bottleneck going by the bar, then an oft-empty dance floor, leading back to the spacious back patio.

XnbGrJNw0wglmqXekW138Q.review_text: i have always been a fan of rosewood (in fact i am surprised that i havent reviewed it already!) - i really like the ambiance in this bar and the owners are really nice.  in fact all of the bars that they have are great - 15 romolo and rye as well.  hmmm - do they have a thing for bars that start with R??  anyway, i like the low lighting and nice seating that they have.  and since the music is usually great, they do have a small dancefloor where i can enjoy the beat.  not sure if they still have it, but they used to have a house drink which was some delicious concoction called a lemon chiffon.  soooo good! most recently i also went to a private b-day party in the backroom which rocked!  its a great space - small bar back there, a few couches, and leads to a little outdoor area that has some tables too.  i would definitely rent it out for a party.  i never even knew it was back there before!  rosewood is definitely one of my favorite go-to bars!

cs1GMqTt5eGmLqQyPijYcw.review_text: I like this place.  I don't like that I've never been able to find the patio.  If it is through the door that is on the right after you walk into that room right beyond the bar, then it was closed last time I went.  It is frustrating, I just want to find the patio.  Freaking out.  Where is the patio????

7d6LQAxkLO8Y5EfviOgs3g.review_text: So far so good! Such a cute place with an awesome patio area. Great space/ layout for private parties (separate room with a dedicated bartender and all) with reasonable minimums and even better fees (you won't find a nice place with a great minimum anywhere in SF). Working with Toni on planning an event here and she's been super helpful. So glad I found this place!  More details to come after the event!

ONDMgVKfQ9W1IDxfUuSDmA.review_text: Another hot date place or even to hang out with friends.  The seating is cool and there is a backroom where you can dance.  If you want to have a private party there's also a private room including a seperate bar area for that too!  It's a pretty good looking crowd, so if you want to just be surrounded by cool hip people, this place seems to fit the mark. But it is small so as it gets late, it gets VERY crowded!

TEtzbpgA2BFBrC0y0sCbfw.review_text: UPDATE (6/12/07):  Came here for Jill K.'s awesome birthday party and had an absolute blast. The service was good, the drinks were spot-on (albeit somewhat pricey), and there was hardly a line for the bathroom. Also, the back room and patio are gorgeous.  I left my card there on Friday. Greg, the owner, had it delivered to Rye (his other bar), and I was able to pick it up on my way home from work. If that isn't genuine hospitality, I don't know what is...  ---  OLD REVIEW:  At Voda:  Stanley K.: Hey, are you coming to Rosewood with us after? Keane L.: I guess so. Is everyone else going? Stanley K.: Just us. Ed M. doesn't do Rosewood. Keane L.: Why not? Stanley K.: *shrugs*  At Chinese restaurant:  Sav B.: I can get us into Rosewood for free. Keane L.: How? Do you know a guy who knows a guy who killed some guy? Sav B.: I know the owner. It'll be good. Keane L.: I think everyone is there by now. Ed coming? Sav B.: Ed M. doesn't do Rosewood. Keane L.: Why not? Sav B.: *shrugs*  At Rosewood:  Keane L.: This place is packed. I can't even move. Kristine J.: Yeah, I'm not feeling this place. Keane L.: Lame. I'm going to take off now. Kristine J.: Calling it a night? Keane L.: Yeah... Keane L. doesn't do Rosewood.

vRziAXWI72nOFWNml4ldMA.review_text: I like this bar. The DJ was really good. Played a bunch of tracks that are normally sampled so we could look at each other and go "man I remember that track". The bar is cool and staff really friendly. Small place but its a cool space. Would have given it more stars had the promotions guy Doug not been such a douche. My gf spent days on end trying to get a hold of this joker about reserving some space for a birthday for her friend. We had like 40 people coming and wanted to see about cover etc. He assures my gf no cover as long as we send a list and that he would reserve a bunch of booths.   Guess what asshole your fucking bar doesn't have any booths. Just a bunch of couches along the wall. Also there is no cover charge. If that's the case why string her along like that stupid ass. Anyways the bartendar was good and it's cool spot. They actually have a nice space in the back which you can actually rent out apparently, since there was another birthday in the back which would have been nice to know. It's off the strip but the DJ makes it worth going. Hopefully he's the house DJ so you guys can enjoy the music like I did.

IllQaEa35pICenTvtvmJPA.review_text: I just threw a party last Saturday night for 100 people at Rosewood, and from A to Z, this place exudes pure class. The bar owner was extremely helpful and prompt in setting up a guest list for the night and the staff was SUPER nice to all of my guests. I'm from LA, so I'm not used to this good treatment from a bar. Usually, in Los Angeles guest lists mean nothing, and doormen give you so much attitude that you never want to come back, let alone throw a party at the venue. The experience at Rosewood  was the antithesis to the "so LA" attitude - it was fantastic.  The bar is perfect size to have a chill spot in the front where people can talk, and a small dance floor in the back where others can shake their asses. The night starts with really chill music that is not too loud so as to let your friends talk, mingle and sip martinis. Then by 10:45 PM, the DJ shows up and plays some fantastic hip-hop - both old-school classic Dre to the stuff they play on the radio today. You get 40 of your friends in this place, and you feel that the bar is entirely your own party. Thus, when we had over a 100, the place felt like it was totally styling. Rosewood is a perfect size to keep the crowd personal and comfortable, as well as allowing people to dance it up in the back.  I had such a good time that the event last night will be one of many at Rosewood. Thanks, Greg, for maintaining such a classy place from your venue to your wonderful staff. I'm sure that your vision for comfortable bars will make Rye just as fantastic as Rosewood. I'm looking forward to check out Rye as wee as your future bars.

e1FuiYSV1v29q2OTR9ojBA.review_text: Me likey - a lot!  Not just cause I got a chance to DJ here for a little bit, but because the drinks were good, the space is nice, and the owner is hella cool (and he's a Yelper).  I love the outdoor patio area - great so us smokers don't have to hang out in front and get weird stares from all the Chinatown locals - and the little dance floor area.  I may have to rent that back bar out one day.  The only problem with this place is that parking is a bitch....but you'd be best off taking a cab, cause you'll probably be three sheets to the wind when you leave!

D2b4DENpkezsw90fC2vWdw.review_text: Rosewood was the post-dinner destination for my birthday.  We thought parking would be ridiculous but it actually ended up being okay. =)  It's easy to miss as there's not really a sign outside.    When I first walked in I was really confused.  There were people just standing around in the back room area and I kept looking for the "private room" area because they sometimes open it up when there isn't a private party going on.  The decor of the main bar area is cute and cozy.  There was a mixup in table reservations and the owner/manager ended up giving our table away to some other girls but they very nicely rearranged furniture to make space for us.  The dj got started kind of late and the music wasn't really dance-y music. Yummy strong drinks though!  There's no dresscode but the bouncer still hassled my friend for wearing flip flops.   It was nice to finally check Rosewood out but I wouldn't go out of my way to come back.

ZeIDWs_A7cDWbbglRdOjeg.review_text: I went here on a Friday night and it was blah...  normal bland and was dead. I mean don't get me wrong, the place is had a nice ambiance to it. Very loungey, acid jazz music in the back ground, good drinks, but i was just wasn't impressed. Oh yeah long line for the guys bathroom, which is un-heard off... so minus 1 star.  I thought maybe it was just that night but when i tried coming here another night, it was closed off for a private party. So maybe if i go here another time i can change my rating but for now it gets a 2.

1oesrOIBYtaJUr2Ug5aioQ.review_text: A great spot off of the heavily-trodden part of Broadway. If you aren't looking for it, you might never notice it's even there due to the unassuming facade of the entrance.  Beautiful decor -- almost slightly retro with all the wood paneling, yet also hip and modern. I love how the DJ is positioned behind the bar, next to the bartenders. The tunes are always fun, often lots of hip hop.  The outdoor patio is a beautiful respite from a crazy evening -- HIGHLY recommended. It has a peaceful zen feel (tons of bamboo, gravel surrounding the cement path) with tons of candles, and plenty of nooks for stolen kisses... :-D  Major props to Greg L. for making Cassio and Julio's party such a success last week. He kept the tasty drinks flowing all night!

ujQai0f4PD10CwqNUG5DUQ.review_text: Definitely not thrilled with this place. Headed to Rosewood for my friend's going-away party and found that the place had been triple booked and was PACKED!  We had to wait in not one but TWO lines in order to get to the back room where our party was and it was so packed that we were near fire code capacity. Couldn't dance, couldn't hear the music, and wasn't allowed to use the restroom because I'd have to wait in line again in order to get back to the back room.  At the end of the night I found out that they had lost my best friend's debit card---really now, really?  Head out to this spot at your own risk!

jeokFgURb-_Yo_McZFBS0Q.review_text: This place has a few options for you and your friends: the front area by the bar, some tables, a (very) modest dance floor, a small atrium, and a back room.  The music is varied, but there's always a strong, hype beat.  Bring a party with you if you like; it doesn't get obnoxiously crowded like some other places.  A fine choice for mingling and drunken revelry.  The decor is nice, the lighting is just right, and the drinks are reasonably priced.  It's also nice that it's somewhat removed from the commotion and crowd of Broadway and Kearny.

LU7ikPXZ5R8tv4oNQZQkKw.review_text: Small bar, cheap drinks, not many people in this place expect for short asians trying to get laid in suits.  Sip is a better choice up the street.

G2FVUXuLEGc2fDTWFaQplw.review_text: Now this was one of the bars that I'd want to parlay in order to get away from the die-hard party animals and packed places in and around North Beach.   Because I am a big fan of smooth R&B, Soul...I loved the music when i stepped in here. The music complemented the ambiance of the bar. The color theme indicated deep reds, dark browns...very sexy and appealing...makes you want to let your hair down and sway to the beat of the music. Though the 2 bathrooms were an issue because none of them indicated if they were for men or women...which in my opinion, seemed kind of weird and towards the end of the night both bathrooms were too nasty to enter into.

Q6T_qAMidIemQlINLwDDeQ.review_text: I liked this random little place ... we went with a group of 10 people, so it was nice that we had enough space to sit and get a drink, or go to the dance floor and dance. They played good hip hop, some old school stuff ... I would go there again if I had a group of people.

6CTaoiEgAX2WRobPgKIx4g.review_text: really nice place to hang out.. the crowd is pretty nice .. good DJ to pick some really good songs to play and not just your typical top 40s.. but they can do a lil bit better on decor.. definitely come back for more though.

j45PuQ1uZeljOh4vCmwi3w.review_text: Went here with the new roomies and their friends. Almost missed it walking by but 3 lovely ladies were visible just inside and that usually gets my attention. So after suggesting we go check it out, I had to do a little explaining (a quick scan for ratio was all the convincing they needed).  Small place, wouldn't want to have to wait in the bathroom line, but drink selection and people looked good. Surprisingly quiet for a saturday. Enough people for fun but not so many you couldn't move.

LNz5NSoV8XVZhxIp5wYh3Q.review_text: This is a pretty cool spot which is hidden in the mist of China Town. I liked how it reminded me of a pimped out 70's crib. I donno maybe it was the wood panel and neat speakers built into the beams. I loved the outside section too, that was was dapper biz right there! They also carry a nice selection of Beer. I will diff party here again.

Tb2PI_4eQw5cq5gpeSkqqA.review_text: Good ambience.  As for music, it was a good mix of old school and today's hip hop.  Bouncer was quiet friendly.  The crowd was cool.  The only somewhat negative thing that I can say about this place was that the bartender was not consistent in term of mixing the drinks.  But a great time overall.   I highly recommend this place.  Definitely a nice change of pace from your typical Hollywood bars or clubs.

FdQZxULvI4GT0-1meVap7w.review_text: Rosewood has lots of potential.   And by potential I mean that they need to decorate this place a bit more (less fake wood and more rose?) and make the place more visible. It's no wonder that by 10pm on a Friday, this place was barely packed.   The private room and outdoor patio was spacious especially for birthdays and other special events. I really like the bamboo and the lounge couches. There was even a separate bar area for the room.   There's really people living on the top?   I know this is the City, but the pour prices make Oakland a better bargain drinking spot.   Happy birthday Kristina A!

5bgsQymr8HDT3tyC1N3Uhg.review_text: this was our first bar of the night and it was still quite early so it was kinda empty. as an out of towner, i certainly wouldnt have found this cute little spot.   the bouncers and bartenders were very friendly here. drinks are pretty strong which is good, less cringe knowing how much we pay for it  =) the music was pretty good too, the DJ played dance hip hop songs. i'm sure this place gets pretty crowded becuz its not very big and there's only a small little dance floor area towards the back.  they have these really cute.....contemporary style tables and chairs in mahogany (i think).....i already had a few drinks by then and it was dark so i can't remember exactly. but ya, this place was very cute. i wish we could have stayed longer but it was too dead for us and we wanted to try other bars too.

D2setZ2_pKZ9CWEb0IgrOQ.review_text: Not a totally fair 4 star review, given that I was here for a private party so I have zero idea what the regular crowd is -- but it's pretty lovely -- clean, sleek, modern -- ample dancy dance space, and an adorable outdoor back patio.   Only gripe is that one of the bartenders is drink sexist -- a friend of mine asked for whiskey on the rocks -- and assuming that b/c she was a girl, she didn't really mean just whiskey, so he made her a whiskey cocktail w/ abt 1/4 cup of agave syrup and a bit of orange juice....which is kind of different  -- and he continued to just say "it'll be great", even after she protested...by the time she got it, it was functionally just a glass of sugar on the rocks, so yes, it was tasty, but not a glass of whiskey.   Despite this slight snafu, if you have to go to North Beach, which I would always advise against, this isn't a bad place to get your drink on -- lots of seating, good music, though it can be hard to get the attn of the bartender when it gets hoppin.  Oh, and if you need to take a cig break outside, it's amazing people watching -- so many tiny girls in such tiny clothing!  It's kind of like watching a continual walk of shame...except for it's the beginning of the night?

JxEgmwYM4qRB-Z7uKeVy6w.review_text: Just rang in our 26th year of life at the best bar ever!  Toni was the perfect host from start to finish.  Made the planning process easier than ever and even asked about special requests we might have in regards to alcohol or anything we wanted to have available at the bar.  Music was easy to manage and the set up was effortless.  Love the lights and outdoor area - tables were perfect for cupcakes and purse/jacket storage for all of my girls!  Highly recommend this spot for birthdays or any party planning where you need a rad venue to bring all of your friends!  Thank you again for making Saturday night one for the books.  Looking forward to the next! :)

1ljC2JgUafYC9wtEUXJ3bQ.review_text: I want to come back again!!  I had just taken an 8 hour law school final, and was dying to get out of the house, even for an hour.  I decided not to drink because I had to get up early to study for my next final!  We got there around 12:30 on a Friday night and surprisingly, I found parking right across the street!  The bouncer was SO friendly and joked with me about how we tooottallllyyyyy need more lawyers... not!  I looked kind of out of place because I had borrowed my friend's maxi dress + sandals.  Everyone else was dressed much more nicely, some on the sluttier end, some not.  Overall the crowd was super classy and pretty young (23, 24, 25)... and attractive!  I want to come back :)

B-Dhfu42z8Ak4BYaS1xpsA.review_text: Update 10/16/07 I'll have to increase the rating to 2 stars for now to give props to the owner of Rosewood for good customer service.   He read my yelp review and supposedly was going to fire the rude door man who DID work there.  I haven't been back since, but maybe on my next visit it'll earn an upgrade.  My first experience at Rosewood was a good one.  I walked in thinking, "wood walls with built-in speakers and records? -- nice!"  The music was okay if you like mainstream "hip hop," but no one was dancing.  At such a small venue, everyone stood crowded around the bar area making it impossible to get a drink, not realizing there was so much space on the dance floor.   Well I guess it was okay enough to give it another shot.  BAD IDEA!!! My friends and I walk up to the door at around 11:30 p.m. and are asked to pay $5.00 cover charge.  There's practically no one inside on a Wednesday night and I had not paid cover before, but we shrug and comply.  Five minutes into the bar we get our beers and turn around to see people freely walking in and out of the bar.  The "door man" is now inside talking with the bar tender, and no one else is getting charged for cover.  Five dollars really isn't a lot of money, but it just seemed so strange to my friends and I that we had to pay cover and 5 minutes later there wasn't any.   My girl friend and I decided to ask the door man why there was no longer a cover, and he stated with a nasty tone, "you assumed I worked here."  He went on to say, "you girls must have been out of the game for too long.  See, I'm a hustler and that's what we do.  Maybe I work here and maybe I don't, but you gave me your money. " Shocked, we just walked away before I punched him.   Back with my group of friends, I see the "door man" talking with the bar tender and giving him "daps."  A few minutes later the "door man" walks towards us and I hear him point toward us and say "bitches." WTF?!?!?! We just left because it wouldn't have been worth it.  Whether he worked there or not, he was friends with the people that worked there, and if they are okay with their friends or workers "hustling" the customers,  it's not a place for me.

2O-9NlmZr0cvGAKs30_CLQ.review_text: The venue itself is clean and gives off a good vibe. What lacks though is their ability to call you back. Even though they have contact information their not very good or pleasant at getting back to you.

3tJcTVPckkv7ZOrn1EcqPg.review_text: A distinctive "you wouldn't know it was there" vibe on the outside keeps this place pretty under cover.  I had a good time here at a buddy's birthday party where he had rented the back room, but in general the main lounge (both in crowd and in decor) was a little too slick for me.  Think Marina via North Beach, and you kind of get the idea.

9KIPXfx757As4CFAh1EZVg.review_text: not too shabby. some pals and i were looking to boogie down after grabbing drinks at 15 romolo, and rosewood was the closest bar with potential. (thank you, yelp app!)  housed in between pet stores and dim sum on broadway, the front end of rosewood was deader than dead on this particular saturday night. i mean, one or two other people at the bar. and for such a well-lit space, it seemed awkward. and, it didn't bode well for our impending dance party.  as we went in search of the bathroom, we found a secret passageway to the back of the bar that led us to a thriving soiree. clearly, a private party. folks were mingling out on the patio and roofdeck (nice touch!) and chatting it up inside a beautiful little mid-century space where the dj was spinning some great funky tunes. we took it upon ourselves to start a dance party going, which, given the stares from the guest of honor, was so not cool. i mean, loosen up, girl! we met a couple other party crashers who were also freeloading off the vibe. not gonna lie, we had a great time.  i suppose this review reflects more on the snotty party girl than the bar itself, but if a party is truly a "private party," they should make sure there's fun available for the non-partygoing patrons as well.

hSD2Lu8Z_62klnMDND5sSg.review_text: This place is really nice.  Not to big not to small.  It's dim and warm (I think sometimes they charge to get in although we've never paid), the drinks are good, there's a nice sized dance floor towards the back, and I think a private room as well.

AGjL2Ow20VNxqKHVfT1hdQ.review_text: The last time I was here (years ago), it was packed and hot and sweaty but fun!  Because Sip across the street was so dead, I headed over to Rosewood.  It was worse! Near empty!  What happened!?!  I must be out of the scene for too long.  Grabbed a few shots, chatted a bit and decided to go back to Sip thinking it would get better (it didnt, read my Sip review). Oh well.

TVJoa1isoHj02_iToGaXcA.review_text: Alright, I will say this, it's a nice place. Does it live up to all the hype, no. But then most bars in the city never do. I know I've b*tched about this before and I'll do it again, most bars in SF suck. The city has no ingenuity or imagination when it comes to bars. And if you can name the 5 you know that are cool you're only proving that the number of good ones can be counted. Not a good sign.   Anyway, this place IN Comparison, is decent. I do like the outdoor patio though SF nights are hardly ever warm enough to accommodate an outdoor venture. Another plus - the music is phenomenal. Wish people were dancing.. though that didn't stop us. So, will you be impressed with the décor? No. Will you like the music and will it, overall, pass muster? Yes.   While you won't be disappointed by this venue, there's no rush to check it out.

uJhbNOl2HaZ9yH5MlHurhQ.review_text: I would give this place 0 stars if Yelp would allow. A friend of mine rented out a room for his birthday. At first all seemed great. Later on in the night when everyone was trying to close out their credit card on file the woman working the bar had NO idea how to do so or what to charge people. At one point she even handed the box full of cards to a group of people waiting to close out and said "grab your card".   That is so incredibly stupid and inappropriate for a bartender to do I couldn't believe it. People were literally passing around a box of cards and taking cards. When I complained to management after they lost my friends card they reacted horribly and proceeded to threaten to kick us out. In fact, a woman (presumably management) with short blonde hair referred to my boyfriend as a "faggot" and told us to leave.  I am not exaggerating when I say we were only trying to get our cards back amid the disorganization of the bar. I will NEVER go back to this bar. I cannot believe how we were treated and how they passed around all the credit cards for anyones taking to a bar full of people.   I would not recommend this bar to anyone and I will never return. This bar is HORRIBLE.

DgjHA9zexvzZgyHO_GZjLw.review_text: The thing this bar really has going for it is the layout. I came here for a trunk show, which had some spectacular vendors. The bar itself extends completely into a back area, complete with a decent-sized room and two really neat patios with picnic tables and flowers everywhere. However, the drinks weren't that great (neither super tasty or strong) and they were expensive. The bartenders weren't the friendly or eager to help anyone, despite the large-ish crowd there for the trunk show. One bartender made a mistake to my friends credit-card tab, charging her $18 for one drink. None of the bartenders apparently knew how to do a refund on the register, which was odd, but they did give us two shots for free to compensate so it was cool they amended their error.

QJ3t1d_-9wIjMi1S58_ivw.review_text: Although we were there early in the night and it didn't yet have many people, it gave me a chance to just pull up to the bar and chat with the staff.  They were very cool and friendly (even though my friends tried their patience).  The music was good and they took some requests which is always great.  Chris was really nice and even made me a nice drink concoction.

mj2wCBzx7RtoL4J2m0xu4Q.review_text: I've only been here for private parties and I think its a great space to have a smaller group of people. One where I can actually hear myself and meet others. I don't go out in North Beach that often and this place is kinda randomly located by itself but its close enough to Russian Hill where you can just swing somewhere else before or after. My favorite part of the bar though is def. the back patio area. It's super cute and nicely decorated. Just be careful walking around back there. It's uneven and after a couple of drinks, you see a lot of people stumbling into walls after missing steps :)

IHMo9oNV6Z2G9Jny0vblGg.review_text: If you're sick of the typical North Beach Broadway scene, venture into the over-closing in China Town area for Rosewood. I don't think I'd be able to find this place again without friends, but it's truly worth a visit if you're in North Beach area. The bar itself is minimalistic - kinda Scandinavian in design. The drinks are good, but the scene can be fairly Marina-ish, so be prepared.

XcXLEu9DSCOmieLSyyRN8g.review_text: I'm reviewing this place so I can remember what it's called and where it is since I always forget...been there once or twice...think they had a film night ...anywayze it's not bad...but of course too much bouncer visibility...is all this bouncer action really necessary?

57OpG6QjpQjVXjjQQxA_Og.review_text: Went here for a dual-birthday party on a Friday night. Nice lookin' place, chill crowd, no cover, relaxed dress code, nice outdoor patio area., DJ was pumpin't out some top 40's and some 90's rap.  Unfortunately, some group had paid to reserve the patio and the front got way too crowded.  Definitely willing to come back and give this place another chance.

oA4ompknoW6XrONKYXQ_jQ.review_text: Maniac, maniac on the floor... and she's dancing like she's never danced before...  For serious,  when I get into the groove, you best get out of my way, because I might hurt somebody (SORRY if it was you!!!) or myself -- goddamn shoes of sexy destruction.  I was the hottest of sweaty messes after a night at Rosewood.  But so were all of you, so I was in the best of company.  5 stars for excellence in bartending (Hi Remy!!).  5 stars for excellence in decor (Candlelight is most flattering).  5 stars for excellence in music (Hi Yelper who spun Dancehall.  I heart you).  5 stars for excellence in  sarcastic quips (Hi Bucky!  I do admit I dance like a stripper.  You owe me $60 bucks.).  5 stars for excellence in organizational skills (Hi Jing Tao.  You're a D-Bag.  And I mean that in the nicest way possible!).   And of course 5 stars for excellence in hangover remedies (Hi Sammy.  Pickles and Grapefruit Airborne!!!).  Good shit, y'all.  Good shit.

0Tv2dl2O0TEQD-VGbPqwug.review_text: This place is great. I was here at one stop on a friend's party bus. I vaguely remember dancing quite a bit on the dance floor. I was told we ended up at McTeague's after. Anyhow, after a crazy night I woke up and noticed my credit card missing. Anyhow, I checked my credit card and the last charge was here at Rosewood. I called the place and a lady there texted me there was a fashion show tonight and I could pick it up then.  I needed my card before a weekend at Tahoe so I swung by after dinner to pick it up. It's hard to find when it's dark but a woman outside asked me if I was looking for the fashion show. So, I went in and asked the bartender if my card was there. While he was looking the women who texted me overhead and introduced herself. She offered me a shot and I accepted. I gave her 5 bucks for being so nice, took a shot, and bounced. I'd love to come back with customer service like this!

I-FmdvI28N7OIIt4JZOgIg.review_text: I didn't know a bar this secluded, but was very happening, existed in Chinatown!  This spot is great for a private event, that is held in the back! It's like a mini version of high rise residential buildings surrounding a glowing nightlife, outdoor patio bar!    Bring an entertaining crowd and you'll have a fun night!

AAI8mmWem4zQU7qanPrOmg.review_text: HAPPY BIRTHDAY JILL K.!!  1.) I realized I've been here before.  2.) Me A. tried to strip me.  3.) Anne Marie touched my boobs and bought me a drink.  4.) Cassio P. and his Brazillian wax stories.  5.) Stepping all over urine in the restroom.  6.) Connie C... Total sweetheart.  7.) Tripping and falling TWO TIMES in front of the Fongz L. and A.J.  Wearing my four-inch heels was worth it.  HAYYYY BABYYYYY!! HOW MUCH?!!!

zQvBRYbPrRA4WWcIDMocUg.review_text: EASILY became one of my favorite bars.  Toni is AMAZING!! I contacted the Rosewood to inquire about celebrating my birthday there and it was such a great decision! Toni responded back almost immediately and addressed any questions I had. She was extremely accommodating and seriously, the sweetest thing! She went beyond my expectations to make my celebration at Rosewood so much more memorable (or as much as I could remember ;) haha).  Rosewood is on Broadway, but basically in the heart of Chinatown - walking distance to the Broadway strip - so it's not far off at all. When you walk in, there's the full bar and the main room is narrow and long, set plenty plush black, leather seating. This main area can be reserve for your private party as I did. In the back, there are private rooms, the outdoor patio and also the dance area. I loved the music selection here. Unfortunately, at the time of my event there could not be a DJ physically spinning but Toni was sweet enough to have the DJ create a pre-set playlist for the night! Normally, they'll be a live DJ spinning old school hip hop, r&b, top 40s.. all the good, funky stuff!  The drinks were good and the bartenders were all super friendly! All in all, if you're here.. you'll have a great time!  DEFINITELY COMING BACK!

DB717wes6bHyiPq0oDl_3g.review_text: This is a great little lounge near North Beach/Edge of China Town.  Around 12:30am on Saturday there was actually a line of about 15 people, but it moved quickly and I was in before I knew it.  I felt like they were understaffed on bartenders, but the crowd was easygoing and nothing seemed like a chore.  I'll definitely go back.  Especially since I waited until 1:30 to check out the back patio and they closed it as soon as I got there.  Bummer.

y2XPvYkAIZWxyknRQYM_EA.review_text: Ok yelpers, I feel a bit let down here. Don't get me wrong, this is a chill, cozy and stylish little lounge, but for a Friday night, this place was sparsely populated with mostly couples. So if you're on the prowl and lookin' for some dance-your-ass off fun on the dance floor and a happenin' joint, this is not the place for the weekends. The music was your pretty standard fare-- the cosmos were a bit diluted, and the bartender wasn't all that friendly, he was more, well accommodating. My friends and I wanted a fun, yet not flash the crowd scene--however, I think we may have scared this timid little "lovers only crowd" Verdict-- come here for a couples or quaint mellow weekend evening out, or for weekly happy hour...other than that, I wasn't terribly impressed.

iKuGWNG9rPtiDhDd7UPRJw.review_text: Came here for a private party, and while the back patio is rly nice, the bartender (there were only two), Joe was insanely rude. I went to the back to ask if they had seen my friend's phone and he screamed at me to get out from the back, and then proceeded to say, "FUCK YOU!" ... To a customer. Are you kidding? I was appalled.

qUg4PXAT42bxV48CqPaUwQ.review_text:
Nevermind the crap-ass parking. Fagettabout the weekend freaks that all come out to pah-tay. Never mind that you'll get drinks spilled all over you just like every other place (more actually!). Nevermind that my friend had her leather jacket and cell phone stolen there. Nevermind that the dj thinks he's Grandmaster Flash (Not! or at least NOT YET!) Nevermind the crowd, the sweat and heat! Nevermind all that y'all! What's left you ask? Well, bartenders are nice. Interesting interior!...at least for the first 5 minutes. But that's like saying, "Apart from that Mrs. Lincoln, how did you enjoy the play?"
  Giving it 3 duckets because they try hard. It's one of the better lounges in NB. Mix a strong drinky.

kDfU-S_-MXk8yaUfM6xUyA.review_text: Ambiance: This is one of the nicest bar/lounges I've been to. Dark, dim, classy, romantic. I had an attentive and nice bartender. Very modern. It's also a very clean place. Few seating chairs inside, small dancing area with a DJ. Another section of the place is in the back. It has 2 rooms, 1 standing room with a bar and another small separate seating area. Can definitely hold a private party back there. Outside of that has a lot of bamboos surrounding the seating area with dim lights and 2 picnic table style seating area. Felt like a tropical little corner. Wasn't too crowded which I liked. Mixed crowd in late 20's. I bought some shots for a friend's birthday and it costed me $9 a shot.   Parking: Street parking is sometimes hard to find around that Chinatown area but if you're patient, you'll be lucky. I drove around the block just once and got lucky finding parking just half a block up. But there is a parking garage behind that block, so it's very convenient too if you don't want to look for street parking.  Set back: Only thing I noticed was the flooring separating from the inside to the outside. Wearing heels, it can be a bit dangerous since there's an unpaved step. Someone can easily trip if they were drunk and all over the place.  Definitely going back there again!

IoCecWMuJWVLfJAyggwY1A.review_text: Good place to hang out with friends, but found other places much better. The dance floor was mucho weak. The drinks were ok. It was pretty empty but sometimes that does suit my fancy.  It's actually probably a good spot for a first or second date if you want to get drinks after dinner. Except it's in the Broadway strip of you know what.  I'd probably come back if someone else suggested it but not sure if I'd go there on my own instinct.

qzu4UQbwcqdTQte0PccVvA.review_text: I feel like this place can be a hit or miss.  Sometimes it can be very quiet on certain nights..and other times you'll try to roll in and it's poppin' like it's everyone's bday in there!  I like the decor a lot.  It gives you this dark, intimate, musky feeling..but yet casual feeling at all?  I'm not sure if that makes any sense whatsoever.  A lot of woody, brown / candles-like environment with a slight twist of modern.  I feel like on slow nights couples can be there after a nice dinner and enjoy themselves.  On the other hand, I've been to bdays in there where everyone is bunched up like sardine cans!  I do wish they had more seats in there, but I suppose when they fill to capacity who needs seats when you can sit on someone's lap.  Ya heard!

27En0DDgdf0_0qK_hjXcLQ.review_text: I've been here for two private events and loved it!   PROs:  -never got too crowded, even with another event going on in the adjacent room -great DJ that took all my annoying requests -plenty of seating  CONs: -not enough bathrooms -expensive drinks -awkward layout (very narrow walkway near the bar, have to push through to get to the restrooms) -location  All in all, the pros outweigh the cons. Not sure how this bar is on regular nights, but it's a great place to hold a private event with all your friends!

ZnBTVsQMCuHdp4qmwrZNeQ.review_text: Happy Happy Joy Joy. I love the outdoor seating. But more so,  I love the wall that you can wall dance like you are in a music video. I especially like it when Graceypoo is doing the dancing.  If that wall were a man, it would be very happy. Oh, and the DJs? All yelpers! Sooooo good. You wanna see Joy dance?? Throw on some old school hip hop or some gritty dance hall  and you gotta nice girl twisting and turning hips.  Yes..... I love to dance.

BMI8iYCk3DxSsbxFTVoq4g.review_text: I came here Friday night for Jennifer M's and Sonja's birthday.  We had our own space in the back reserved for our group.   They had a bouncer posted at the entrance to the back so we felt pretty V.I.P.  There were couches and little tables, and there was plenty of room for all of us to hang out.  The bar area was a bit more narrow, so it felt like we were packed in tight and you feel like you are in every body's way. The bar in the back wasn't a full bar, but they all the stuff for our staple drinks so it didn't really matter.  The bartender was pretty cool.  There was a continuous line at the bar so he was pretty busy and he handled it well.  There was also a side patio with tables where all of the smokers gathered, and the bathrooms were big but they only had two of them!  Overall it was a nice bar, and you can be really dressed up or dressed casual and still feel comfortable.  I usually try to stay away from the north beach/chinatown area at night because it's usually a lot of out of towners and assholes, but Friday was definitely an exception!  I would come back here again, but probably only for a big event.

B33KEetBrqpnJbQZetY3sQ.review_text: You don't happen on Rosewood randomly.   It's on a block in Chinatown, not North Beach, that is almost completely shuttered up at night.  The block is exceptionally dark in comparison to the bright lights of the strip clubs across Columbus.    There is no big bright sign announcing the presence of a bar, nor are there many lights inside that shine out to the street.   I had to wander around for a bit to find it on a Wednesday night.  That said, this may be the best functionally designed bar I've ever seen.  There's a great semi-hidden patio area with lots of little nooks to hang in when commotion inside requires a respite.   The interior is filled with tasteful wood panelling and couches.   My only complaint is the high price of beer (count on over $5 before tip), but I should not have been drinking beer here anyway.

S5WQcThM04eH7Eu0YJ1a1Q.review_text: This review is for the back room of Rosewood only. And no, this review is not about a make-out session, it's about their private party room. Get your mind out of the gutter, will ya?  I've come to the conclusion that Rosewood is really the best deal in town for a birthday party. For only $200, you can rent the whole back space, which includes a full bar, dance floor, lounge, a bamboo garden and outdoor patio to accommodate up to 100 of your peeps.  I love that this space is swanky, yet spare enough to turn it into whatever you want with the right party props. Richard T had a fabulous OMGYG party with flashing lights, paparazzi and cupcakes. Ligaya T did it up for her man Russ S with an ice luge and tequila shots. Mmmmm.  Ain't no party like a Yelp par-tay. Woot!

uVYUAiqgCqs2xAGpYb0LgQ.review_text: Great service for private party. Had a nice outdoor space in the back and we're very accommodating

JSeew6ZpwPpz5QjvnHNcIw.review_text: I like it here.  Its SOOOOOOOO nice to go to a place where the DJ actually has some taste in music. And who would've of thought? Located in North Beach.   I like that its not crazy crowded. Some reviews below mentioned there were hardly anyone there and its funny, some nights,even friday nights,  thats exactly what I look for.

a9gIpre7NPS_CMqNxHU6lQ.review_text: well i guess im going to have to start off by stating that i myself have rarely been known as a sharp dresser when in the bay area... wait scratch that, i've NEVER been known as a sharp dresser anywhere. now i could bring out the whole excuse of how i always end up going out after i get off of work and that it would take me an hour to go home and shower and make myself look spiffy, but i dont really feel like saying any of that. but whats ironic about all of this is that i HATE feeling underdressed. im sure some of us can recall those times when you walk up in to a spot and absolutely everybody is wearing their $80 button down shirts with the smooth slacks and the gelled hair giving me dirty looks (LA flashbacks! LA flashbacks!) but how this all comes together is that when at the rosewood anything goes!  You can take a quick look around the place an notice that everyone is doing their own thing and that somehow it all comes together perfectly. The jean and t-shirt crowd mixes well with people decked out to the fullest.   The place itself is very well put together with a bit of an upscale touch. the bar puts out some great drinks and i've never not seen a plethora of good looking women (on weekends at least). which in SF can be hard to find sometimes. i've always gotten the impression that you can go to this place at times and quickly realize that some 22 year old girl from san jose is having her "big birthday night in the city". so if you happen to be a person who finds those crowds to be annoying maybe this isnt the spot for you. but all in all ive never had a bad time here...

A1fZP8vgbXjNcCJ2pAzQDg.review_text: Came here for a friend's birthday. My friends didn't end up getting drinks from the bar. It was a busy Saturday night and there was only one bartender who knew how to mix drinks. The other guy was just pouring from the tap or wine bottle. The wait for cocktails was long. I ended up trying 2 drinks: Midori sour and vodka tonic. The Midori sour was average and it was mostly watered down. The vodka tonic was really gross - the lime didn't help.   The atmosphere was chill. It was crowded but there was plenty of places to sit - tables are chairs in towards the back. My group decided to sit by window in the front. As the night progressed, it got really hot and stuffy inside. So it was a relief to be sitting by the door where we had some fresh air. There was a small group of people dancing in the back.   The place is small and I would never know that it was there unless I was actually looking for it. A place to chill if there's nowhere else to go.

07Dq64NelrtSGRnhnou6Ig.review_text: I came here with no expectations and left with a big smile on my face.  My friend Darien celebrated his b-day here last saturday night.  As usual I drove to avoid having to fight for cabs after hours.  I am glad I did because there was a parking garage about a block away.  The lounge was pretty accommodating.  two separate rooms with a bar in each and a cozy little out door where people were not afraid to light up,  Not loud like a club but the bar was stacked like one.  Normally I take pictures of the the food or the decorations or the building, this time I decide to post photos of some of the birthday party attendees and other folks who happened to be there that night. Enjoy!

pJHjKQSRu4ziGIEk9mx5WA.review_text: Rosewood was referred to me by a great friend as I researched for affordable, private, classy and overall comfortable location for a birthday party.   My contact Toni was hard to reach at times but we managed after some email phone tag and such. Overall, Toni is extremely accommodating to your needs as a host. It was a pleasure to work with her.   Venue is located in the least expecting area. "Don't judge a book by its cover" clearly qualifies here. The interior is updated and classy. We reserved the two private rooms and the patio which was a bit large for our group but who doesn't appreciate room to breathe? Private bar to avoid wait lines was definitely a plus. We had a bar tab to meet ($1000) but that's cake when there's 40 people drinking in celebration. Outdoor patio sold me. It was lit up with lights on the bamboo and made it very classy and welcoming.
