Awesome set up!   Eric, our personal bar tender was outstanding. Lawrence our "security" is the friendliest security guy I've ever met; he tells you to get out of the private area with a charming smile. lol  Overall, I would definitely recommend Rosewood for a weekend bar stop and a great private party location.   Thank you for such a pleasant experience, Rosewood!

aREzu8wiB_1NYMzi_TgN0A.review_text: Came here for a private party. Nice, dark, and warm atmosphere at the same time. Music was great. There were couple rooms that one can maneuver around with an outdoor patio. The bar had the standard drinks. We didn't have trouble with getting drinks or getting weak drinks. So, either way, we had a great time.

qWOqPXPcaz_vz_ki2n1I8A.review_text: Okay, I'm a bit faded right now but didn't want to forget the good stuff so gotta Yelp! now!  Our bomb ass company had our annual prom here this year and we had a great time. Good dj and excellent drinks! We also had tacos catered by Tacolicious and that's in another review--delicious.  Anyway, drinks were flowing and strong. My favorite bartender, Venise? (V with Denise?) made up a beautiful concoction when I asked for Blood Orange. It is now called the "Elixir" -- you HAVE to try it if you go. Very tasty alcohol of blood orange, pomegranate, ginger and vodka. Yum!  The space is pretty great with a patio and also a small dance floor. Lots of places to lounge as well.  Thanks for having us, it was EPIC!

aqWXHhcR_CdmKmxggFOlEA.review_text: Until Saturday night, I hadn't been to this bar in...almost four years.  Wow.  I remember the layout being much better then than it is now.  It's about the same size as my thumb - this bar/lounge/club (whatever you want to call it) is the size of my thumb, and they seem to let in way too many people for the size of the space.  Even early in the night, it was packed but it's primarily because the layout of the bar is just tough - there are barstools and just opposite those are low tables and loveseats; so the area where people wait to try to get drinks is the same area that is the main thoroughfare between the front of the club and the back with the dance floor and bathrooms.  It is way too crowded making it nearly impossible to move throughout the bar or to get a drink.    The music is pretty good and lots of fun - mostly old school hip hop and pop.  The dance floor area seems to just become an extension of the bar since there isn't much room to stand; so while there are people dancing, there are also a number of people milling around the dance floor with drinks.  There are only two (unisex) bathrooms, and I was surprised to consistently see more men in line than women.  Ladies, don't break the seal early in the night - the bathroom line is long...    They charge $5 cover.  I know it's only $5, but I just don't think it's worth it because you won't be able to get a drink and will barely be able to move.    Rye is soooo much better.

SQIl43bNVRme0dvCFL7T4A.review_text: We held our 10 year high school reunion at rosewood in last November, and Toni and her gang were amazingly hospitably awesome!!! She took care of us every step of the way, as we booked our private event at Rosewood. She constantly updated us on details and options on how to book the bar, and it turned out to be a huge success!   We would like to say a big thank you to Rosewood, from Pinole Valley High school c/o 2000 10 year reunion organizers. THANKS A BUNCH!

7n1Q3Z_Yp_7xNaky6CUS6w.review_text: I had a great time celebrating my 25th birthday here. Toni was an absolute wonderful person to work with. She always responded to my emails in a timely manner. Everyone loved the code word to enter the party and the specialized drinks for my party. I had a "Mean Girls" themed party and it was so fetch!

tpjZkjtPVjowW_EGlOO1lQ.review_text: After going out to Rosewood on a Saturday night, I'd definitely recommend if you are in North Beach.  No cost to hang coat, nice coat rack provided for self-service Drinks are reasonable - $7 for a Kamikaze Drinks are excellent - they actually use fresh lime and lemons, which goes a long way Swanky lounge feeling, a nice place to bring upscale friends. Dress to impress. Dance floor - pretty fun, nice soundsystem, pretty good dj playing all the top 40 overplayed songs.

aea3PTk1cMMV7UTh9HXINA.review_text: Unfortunately I'm not a big fan of shelling out $6 for one beer. But on the plus side I have big teeth, semi-long eyelashes, and a pretty healthy chestal region, which when I sadly ask the bartender at Rosewood if there are any cheaper beers gets me a sympathy drink, for free.   Although I really appreciate the sympathy drink, I don't appreciate spending $4 on a PBR. Sorry about all the "poor me" talk, but I'm unemployed ya'll. I can barely afford to buy Ramen  noodles, so cheap beer has become seriously important to me. Because unemployed people have nothing better to do then drink...a lot...alone...while watching hours of America's Next Top Model reruns.  Yelp DJ Battleship 2.0 got my slowly plumping ass out of my apartment for a night to bump a little, grind a little, sweat a little, and have JT's bacon dog pressed against my back a little. It was all in good fun though. The staff are friendly...get it? staff? I mean, what?  The dance floor is slamming, and by slamming I mean drunk bitches body slam you into the walls, which I guess I don't really mind, because the wall just happens to be the most cooperative and unskevy dance partner there is.  And the candle light and woody surroundings=a butt-load of sexy...except when it includes candid photographs of yours truly.

PyItxzr83FRB3h5Plws3EQ.review_text: Had a wonderful night at Rosewood bar for a friend's private birthday party in the back private room. I was surprised to hear that there was no cover charge or rental fee associated with reserving the private room in the back. Sure, their drinks weren't exactly cheap (average of about $8 to $12 per drink), but they were tasty and the ambience was wonderful.   I will admit though, I thought that the location of this bar was a little bit weird. I mean, it's on the edge of Chinatown. At night, nothing next to it is open at all. In fact, it's not exactly the best neighborhood to be walking around at night. That being said, also be very cautious of the main intersection there, as I encountered a major police trap there for no left turns, among other things.  Overall though, this is a great location to have a private party. I'm not sure if I would necessarily come all the way out here just for a drink since it's out of the way for me, and there are plenty of other choices. But definitely a good location for a private party. Would recommend if you're looking to entertain.

KHJMzJTXayOwyBxSWLWCQg.review_text: Terrible!!! Avoid at all costs!!  My Friends surprised me by hosting my bday party at this place. Located at a terrible neighborhood it looked good at the beginning. I went to the back (patio) at some point with my friends and suddenly  some guy appeared and asked me : "what the f*** are you doing here"?" I replied this is my bday party. Soon enough I was being escorted to the exit of the bar with 20 of my friends. When I complained to the "manager" (a blonde waitress) I was treated extremely rude. She  said, I still find this hard to believe, if you don't like it just bail. On my birthday !! Incredible !!  Lessons learned: STAY AWAY!!!!  If you have to go: do not make the mistake of planning your bday party there!  Terrible!

MnCteyXrn2d1qFygzgh4mA.review_text: Wow, nice bar, hardly notice it from the street, but nice design and layout, although strange seats at the bar, a dance floor, and even a nice little garden for all you folks still addicted to your smoky treats. The night I went there they had a few DJ's and a grand time was had by all. It seemed to close a little early, but that was probably for the best.   Drinks, they have a good selection of beers on tap, and a full bar, but they don't make Mojitos (which if I was a bar tender I would probably refuse to make as well as their a pain in the  ass)

whfjd0gIdtPXLTZKmNYqZQ.review_text: Reminiscent of a Scandinavian designed ski chalet, Rosewood (named for the rosewood paneling that adorns it)  is one of my favorite bars in North beach. The boys behind the bar know how to mix a drink, and the lighting is very flattering. It can get a bit hectic with Marina types at times, but you can always escape to the patio :).

S3gNrUh7N9oWoackKlHGMQ.review_text: It should come as no surprise that this place was completely empty when my cousins and I waltzed in at 8pm on a Saturday, after a very filling dinner with extended family members.  That said, the bartender was very kind and helped us explore the different vodka options behind the bar.  I tried a cinnamon vodka, which was nice and SPICY and we enjoyed running our hands along the smooth wall.

ipleTHGh9KR8hO5U1yxzXw.review_text: You know what....this place is random.    No sign, no indication of it's existence beside smokers on the outside.   Still...it was a blast to be there with Yelp folks.  A random night with random folks resulted in a random night of dancing.  It's pretty cool...or maybe it isn't....it is in North Beach.  EVERY bar in North Beach is known somehow and crowded like mad on Fri&Sat.  I can't imagine this place being comfortable with a crowd. Regardless.... I had fun here.

lXKjU1d7uy4aG0c5dNTATw.review_text: definitely one of the best places to hit up in north beach so you get the jump-off for the night. i feel sexy when i kick it here for a round or two. eargasms while listening to mash-ups and soulful house. you know i could work it.   i love how this place is dimlit, dark and lovely. guys know how to dress here. ahh the days when i was single, blood. ahaha

4XpBOUei-QLDrMfvf03wkg.review_text: The place is nice, good place to hang out with friends, meet a few people, hang out. The music was half good half not, the dj would play a good song for every few bad songs. The night I went there weren't enough bartenders. The lighting is decent but I think they could do a lot better. Overall this place is ok for a chill low-key night.

bWvELivVIa81tFEqiLxS4A.review_text: I came here for a friend's birthday party on a Friday night.  Somewhat of a very random lounge in the middle of a street that seems to have nothing else.  The backroom that many reviewers seem to rave about was blocked off for a private party, so I was disappointed I never got to check it out.  The front area got crowded later at night, and it was annoying that my bartender kept on disappearing for extended times of the night (I realize there are other bartenders, but I usually pick one in the beginning and tip initially to get better service).  The lounge minus the backrooms is pretty small, so I don't suggest having a huge birthday party here.  But for a small gathering, it seems to be a very chill place to hang out.

dlAxvWcrqZJPkhFTWru6Ew.review_text: Great place for private parties! I had my "goodbye SF because I'm moving to Portland" party here and they made a special drink menu for me (with Oregon-themed drinks) and decorated the bar with Oregon maps. And we had our own dedicated bartender! Seriously, call Toni and book it for all your private parties.

KURUGmYN2kwDpr6BcEcrRA.review_text: I came here last night with a whole bunch of friends for a 3 person bday celebration. My first impression was that they didn't have enough lounge chairs, but by the end of the night...I didn't want to sit down anyway, so I guess it didn't really matter. We had called in a few weeks ago to "reserve" an area, and sure enough, the entire place was pretty much ours. I'm not sure of what exactly happened, but by the end of the night, only our friends were inside. I wonder if they kicked non-party ppl out?  Anyways, drinks are strong. Bartender lady was really nice. She made the bday girls a shot of "strawberry shortcake". SO GOOD. The bathroom is actually decent and not gross. Music was good. Not too hot, but yes, quite small. Great for a gathering like the one we had last night. The dancing area is in the back, and quite small. But it was a great set-up - you can talk/drink, or walk a few feet and dance. I would highly recommend this place for a bday gathering.

mr2Xey5LnT6xJJeNuh0oKg.review_text: One of my all time hidden gems in the city. I know, I know--not so hidden but seriously this place is great. 90's hip hop--check. Endless Summer playing on the back wall--check. Good drinks--check. Cool people--yep. Place is always poppin. Has a good crowd and a great place to chill before a big night or just hang for the night. Highly recommended.

p7yKeDEv6EXT_OEZBgIJjQ.review_text: This place could be a hit. The bartender was nice and speedy. The drinks were neat and tasty. The door guy was a foul mouth jerk. The African American guy within the door was nasty and disrespectful. He made some pretty tacky and racy comment at one of the ladies in out group. We were there celebrating a friends birthday and he single handedly ruined our night. So, if you like to be disrespected by the help, this is your bar!

wT78sHs-9lhLretYlpx7UA.review_text: I attended a private party here.  Here are my observations: RATING SHOULD BE ZERO!!!!!' 1. Setting wasn't set up for the party as requested by people renting venue. 2. Main bar was not able to serve any drinks other than beer, wine & was not set up yet for hard liquor drinks 3. Party was set up in back where there was an outside courtyard adjacent to a room with open sliding glass doors which had a track that people could trip over.  There were no propane heaters in the outside courtyard in San Francisco in February!! Unbelievable!   4. Room where we were setting up food was sooooo dark you could barely see what you were doing. 5. Only two unisex bathrooms.  One backed up around 10 pm into the evening, with 100+ people in the private party & then the bar was opened to the public so there was an additional 100+ people with one unisex bathroom!!  Long lines & long wait to use the bathroom!!  None of the management tried to call a plumber or fix the situation.  When asked about the bathroom predicament, they said it happens all the time!!!! 6.  Finally got in the only bathroom & then realized there was NO toilet paper or paper towels.  Ugh :(. When I left the bathroom, I went to the bar, as a courtesy to the bar, to let them know they were out of toilet paper & paper towels to dry my hands.  Joe, the bartender, who was also very impersonable & smug said to me "at this point, I really don't care!" 7.  I then found Toni, the manager and told her about the lack of toilet paper & paper towels.  I told her what Joe said that he really didn't care & she said "you must be confused"!!  Confused about what - that I couldn't wipe or dry my hands!.  She basically called me a liar!!  What happened to customer service!! 8.  Isn't not having adequate bathrooms and toilet paper & paper towels, a health violation especially with the flu epidemic going on right now with people dying from it!!!   9.  Start caring about your customers!!!! 10.  On a positive note, the security staff was great - Malcolm, Lawrence and a third guy from Memphis were very pleasant, helpful & provided great customer service!  Toni & Joe should take lessons from them!!

OniLiyqsK0qKv4kptqzipg.review_text: Real cool off scene joint with good hip hop, full bar, intimate dance floor, and friendly people.  It's really more than a lounge than anything.  Lot of modern but simple decor, dim, and super cozy.  There have been some celebrity sightings in here, it's rumored.  I wouldn't say the place would get really jumpin', but it's a great spot to cool out with someone special or perhaps to start the night off as a meeting point.   It's real low key, no TV, full staff, high ceilings, and even a private room for rent in the rear.  I will say that it sometimes gets packed, but never for really long.  I think a lot of people end up heading down to the 5 or 6 major clubs down the street.  Great place to host a small get together where you only want to mingle with your own crew.    The place is small but mysteriously inviting.

VHdY6oG2JPVNjihWhOooAQ.review_text: Rosewood I love you.  Your outdoor patio.  Your elegant bamboo.  The skinny mirror in front of the bathrooms.  Your quick friendly bartenders.  Your chic black leather seats.  Your ability to hold two completely different parties at once.  Your ability to bring down the house with Whitney Houston's 'I Want to Dance with Somebody.'  Fabulous  - usually does the trick for most places. But you surpass fabulousness. You are like Tom Jones, overalls, mango and sticky rice, Whitney Houston - all rolled into one discreet North Beach package.  I love you.  That is all.

dTcYw_RuYUm-j83emwDnUQ.review_text: I'm on an in between scale on this one...  This place has left me looking back with a mysterious feeling... What is up those stairs, what is behind that wall, what else does this place have to offer besides beautiful, people easy access bars, room after room of loungey vibe to dancing vibe, to both, to outdoor dinning? I don't know, what else is there? I want to know more. Alright so, I'm intrigued... But not completely satisfied.   We came here on a whim. I was tired ready to hop in bed when my friend talked me into checking this place out. When you are in the mood I was in, no place is cool and desirable to be at besides your warm bed. But this place pleasantly surprised me. I am looking forward to going back and partying it up.   For this night, I was only the sober observer, which in case normally would get a less than positive review from me, accept in this case.

4XpJ4HKD5OQ3H5Gy330CkA.review_text: Have been to Rosewood a handful of times ranging from 2003 to 2009. I have to admit, I want to like the venue more than I do, but it falls short of my expectations every time. Here's why:   * while the venue is quaint and classic, it's narrow and the back room lacks seating and tables.  * or maybe that back area was meant to be the dance floor, but it wasn't very well thought out.  * music is hit or miss, but no real mixing beats.  * crowded, and takes a lil while to get your drink order in. (Having said that, the bartenders are friendly and have a good attitude in serving the masses.)   But here's what I do like about the venue:  * chill location, where it's not so loud you have to scream to be heard.  * no cover  * as mentioned above, good bartenders (at least at my last 2009 visit)  * very unlike the rest of North Beach's drunken debauchery even though it's just blocks away from it all.   Despite it all, it's still worth returning for a chill evening out with a somewhat mixed crowd and decent ambiance.

zy2cNfG4lLE3SlY9p2OL-A.review_text:
i love this hidden gem in north beach ... it is literally hidden, i found myself lost walking up and down broadway the first time i tried to find rosewood ...
  during early happy hours, it's the best place to organize a fun get2gether with friends, no crowd, while u have all its hip ambience, rosewood finish, and narrow space all to yourselves ... a nice patio area, and a second bar for private parties ... i love early cocktails during thurs and even friday nights, before the primetime nights ...
  have been here too during primetime nights, hiphop deejay is hit or miss, crowd can be unpredictable, sometimes the bridge and tunnel crowd, sometimes some locals from all flavors of SF neighborhood ... it is also a great venue to do a for the girls (or boys) night out ... 
  while, last friday this was my last stop for the night;  sometimes, you'll meet that hot stud (or studette for the male readers out there) ... that will make you smile for the rest of the weekend, until the next ephemeral encounter .. ;-)
  it's a fun joint, it's unpredictable ... i've always perceived the bartending staff to be consistently friendly and seemingly able to withstand the pressure of the crowd.

I5ctrq9WNVNir8GlATNYkw.review_text: After reading all the positive reviews I was shocked in how bad of an experience I had at this place.  Decor wise, its pretty nice but let me tell you my gripes.  Cover charge; uncrowded at the time and there was no special DJ or anything else to legitimize $10 entry.  It was a friends birthday so I had to pay otherwise no way.  I walk in, and the place is nice, very odd location though, but there is one bartender.  Yep, on a friday night.  So I am like great, drink service is going to take forever, and it did.  As the place filled up, I noticed a complete lack of diversity in the clientle.   Besides me and my group of friends and maybe 5 other people the place was entirely Asian.   I typically don't notice things like this especially in The City, but it was honestly a little awkward for me.    I probably won't return since I hate paying cover to drink overpriced booze and that area is not my typical cup of tea.  Maybe I was just there on an off night, who knows....

yTNuMXKuqbgrn88Q-iwIlw.review_text: Been one of my neighborhood go to bars for awhile now. If you ever want to throw a bday party it's an awesome place to get friends together in the background and with a beautiful patio (especially in the summer time). They were great with us bringing in food, playing our own iPod & they had a personal bartender for us in the back that took care of all of us! So there's always a line for the bathroom, it's a small place and that's why it attracts folks especially in the heart of all that mayhem in n.beach. I still enjoy this place but I second the DJ reviews it's been given. Give it a try. ;)

aiENR_tVypxkpRky5H7gvQ.review_text: I almost  hesitate to write a review because this place is so fantastic I want to keep it as my little secret.   I held my wedding reception here a few weeks ago in the private back area.    The space is beautiful, inside and outside , with a bar area and plenty of lounge seating, as well as space for a DJ and dance floor.  I was able to bring in decorations to fully realize the 60s mod vibe and the space really provided all of the city chic I wanted and Toni was fantastic helping make it all happen.  Rosewood was really the cherry on top of my dream day

dDF1wdIsZsWQon1ZwgSGsg.review_text: I was presently surprised by Rosewood. I came here for a friend's birthday party and had no idea what to expect.  Another friend helpfully warned that the entrance is very nondescript, and it is. To find it, look for a place with no signage on a block without anything else open, but a bouncer out front.  Entering the bar it wasn't too crowded, maybe just about right. After saying hello to my friend I went to get my first drink, a gin martini, naturally. The wait was a typical for a bar, which is to say, too long. While waiting though I got to see several cocktails made, with more care than most places will put in, someone here is clearly making an effort at high-quality drinks. Everything is made with fresh juice and real mixers. My gin martini was correctly *stirred* and came with the twist I asked for cut right there from a lemon.  The interior is nicely done and the DJ was pretty good. The music was a little louder than I would have liked though, making it a bit hard to talk.   The only real downside is the crowd. It was a little too business school for my tastes, Marina-lite perhaps. But really this wasn't a serious detractor. On the up side of this downside, at least that crowd will actually dress up to go out. It was nice to be in an SF bar where 90% of the people *weren't* just in T-shirt and jeans.  OH, I almost forgot. They take credit cards, although no AMEX. I was in a bar where I actually opened a tab, that part was heaven. Note to bars: if you let me open a tab, I'm far more likely to start ordering rounds of shots (which I did).

v5xfQidWLPrRx87tx0dDDg.review_text: Just had girls' night out here this past Friday and we LOVED this place! Cute, little intimate bar with a dance floor in the back and a patio out back (didn't get a chance to check it out) for all you smokers or couples who just want some "alone time" ;-).  It's very easy to walk past, so count the building numbers as you're walking up Broadway. Great music, (mostly hip hop on a Friday night) and there was a birthday group there too that gave me and my friends free cake and ice cream! The bartenders are super friendly (my friend left her iPhone sitting out in plain view on our table and Toni (high energy female bartender with a blonde pixie cut) picked it up and gave it to me, saying she didn't want us calling the bar the next morning, crying over a stolen/lost iPhone).  They seem to have specialty drinks that rotate on some sort of basis and lots of other enticing libations to loosen you up. Free coat check too!

7z-Crwkwo3wyngtjFhdJ9A.review_text: Got lucky with parking but not with reservations..  I had been in contact with someone from Rosewood regarding reservations and the process was very easy.  She reserved us two couches in the main bar for free and there was no cover.  We got there around 10:30 and the place was DEAD quiet.... like pin-drop status.  (The DJ was setting up....late...)  So, I met the person who helped me with my reservations... to find out she accidentally gave up our couches (on the better side of the bar) to another group of asians who didn't have a ressie but said they did?  But she didn't ask for their party name?  .........................  She did make up for it by grabbing us a 3rd couch and setting us up on the other side.  PLUS, she made some stiff drinks and even re-made drinks that we didn't like.  We got to see the private back room, which was cool but I thought it was alot bigger?  Apparently, it can fit up to 100 people and the bar min. is $1000.  dizams....  I think we spent a good amount before bouncing... but it was definitely not the experience I was hoping for.    Hope to update my review in the future, tho... the private room in the back seems awesome.

eBnToKDLoXxQvpwY6s5UdQ.review_text: almost missed the bar....but it was a very nice laid back bar...  nice bartenders and great drinks....and they put up with indecisive girls =)

kYBV4bJd4aoXqwpsVTpAGw.review_text: Takes forever to get a drink, but they're good.  Cool place with a dance floor, bar, lounge and patio.

hdAyZnCKfLB7Tm1b9skyfQ.review_text: We had a private party at Rosewood the other night and it could not have been more perfect. The place is just beautiful!! Greg Lindgren, one of the owners was super accommodating, and helped make the event stress-free. We used the back-room to have a movie screening, and there was comfortable seating for all of us (about 30 people). Plus, we are a smoking crowd, so the patio area was a great bonus. Tom the bartender makes a mean drink!!  :)

pQMbjcDfr7A1aKtU_ls00w.review_text: Yeah...so this place pretty much kicks a$$ for private parties.

ca0N3Fl3FckAWyupp6sDgQ.review_text: Who would think that a spot like this would be just outside the Broadway tunnel, hidden amongst the Chinese restaurants and shops of North Beach? Not me, at least until I went here for the first time as part of Julio's and Cassio's fundraiser event for the Starfish Greathearts Foundation (starfishcharity.org). I had heard mixed things about Rosewood before going here, but really enjoyed myself when I finally went. I totally dug the feel of this place, and loved the fact that they had so many rooms where one could hang out...I didn't make it into the back room (because it was closed) but the outdoor patio was cool. The drinks were fairly priced, the staff was awesome and the clientele (all my fellow Yelpers, as well as a bunch of friends of Julio and Cassio) were cool and a blast to hang with. The DJ was mixing some good stuff that night, and the dance floor (which is a bit small) was generally crowded with people shaking what their mommas gave them... I'll definitely make it back here, and am curious to see what Rosewood is like on a regular night...

0RwIQ8MU-VEsYmZpT_v1VQ.review_text: So I'm a benevolent guy...first time going here and I gotta say...THANK GOODNESS SIP WAS ACCROSS THE STREET...  Givin the spot 3 stars and I think that is pretty liberal, but I'm going to give it the benefit of a doubt and try it again some time soon..here's why  It was 10:30 PM and just as we left the pizza parlor, filling our stomaches with alcohol absorbing bread ammunition, we were all ready to grab some drinks and lose ourselves...but when we got there, the place was somewhat crowded, but the DJ was playing some crappy music.  It was as if it was a Monday night at 8 PM and he was mixing whatever he likes for shitz and giggles...the rest of our party were thinking that it was still too early and maybe the better music would play later. 45 minutes later, with drinks in our hands from a very serious bartender, the music was still not poppin, and I think there was something wrong with the audio system.  So we all decided to be like nomads and travel to the next lounge...SIP...which was more what we were looking for... a great dj spinning good music, a good crowd, and fun bartenders...I will definitely give Rosewood another shot...maybe it was just an off night...but how could Saturday be an off night...I Don't know....we will see in the near future...

byUZpVzun-vVMMCFMXvdXQ.review_text: After a few recommendations by some fellow Yelpers, I finally checked out Rosewood. My date and I arrived to find out that there was a private party going on. However, a gentleman that seemed to be an owner or manager, very graciously let us in after speaking to us for a few moments. We were greeted by a very attractive interior and bar on the left side that included a dj at the far end. The outdoor area is small but perfect for better weather when smokers want to get their fix. The music, much to my delight, was mainly east coast hip-hop and rap that night. It's great that they're open to playing that out here...you know, that whole east coast - west coast rivalry thang... The place was full of well-dressed, attractive and approachable people, although my date and I pretty much spent most of our time getting to know each other. We also agreed that it was a place to revisit as the party that night was mainly woman who were about 5'10" and taller and the men were freakishly tall as well. Perhaps a party for really hot tall people in town! Who knows?  I will go back to see what it's like on a different night and share my final thoughts.

txrANKGe5_pxA9vw4XqyTA.review_text: D-bag bouncer says it's a private party and asks me who i know there.  I said i didn't know it was a private party.  He then says "can you read?!" and points to a small, unassuming sign. Then he says "i'ma be nice to you just this once but i want you to learn your lesson."   Dude, you're a bouncer, get a real job.

_S5tB9stFX3YKLBPVoEjqA.review_text: went here for angelo's 50th bday. we had the backroom and patio to ourselves. we also had our own bartender, although i was too hungover from the previous night to actually order anything. scratch that---i ordered a diet coke and downed it in 3 seconds which caused somebody's jaw to drop, thinking i had just downed a mixed drink that quickly. they had little snacks for us, but i think i ate too much of the spicy cheese because i was shitting bricks all day on sunday. the patio was cool, although there was a creepy alley-way that smelled like a dead body. i wasnt about to check up on it...good experience, maybe we can celebrate your 51st here next year, angelo.

nlOxarS20luHkAloH5YyzA.review_text: I really like this bar.  It's the kind of place that's very middle of the ground.  Your yuppie friends that like fancy places and dressing up will like it and come here and your dirty friends that like dive bars where you wear tennis shoes and t-shirts will like it and come here.  It's the ultimate please everyone type of place.    Without a doubt this is the least stressful venue in the city for planning a party.  I planned a party here and they were very clear and straightforward about the terms.  I highly recommend this place for birthday parties, bon voyage parties, etc. because there is an extra room in the back and patio outside.

5HEbeSrj8CJxw1VGNXV4KA.review_text: I am not sure what everyone else is crying about, but this place is great!  I had no problem with the service, the most friendly bartenders in SF!!  The drinks were AMAZING, some of the best that I have had seriously!  The music was great, and it was an awesome night.  Everyone was in a good mood, dancing the night away.  Thank you Rosewood!!! I am def. coming here again as this is a hidden gem in SF.

FP6C8cb-9riK10ONRNARsg.review_text: I have headed to this place a couple of times over the past few weeks and had good times.  Its been hit or miss in terms of the crowd but DJ Satva plays there on Friday nights and I like to go listen to him.    If you're in North Beach give this place a shot, especially for Friday nights.

Er0hnraJKQ8qpWOHg_iYVA.review_text: A cool little bar in North Beach that I never would have made it except for last nights event charity event...I'm not sure if last night was indicative of the usual crowd at the bar but I doubt it since it was rife with Yelpsters. Definitely worth a trip back to see what the place is like on a normal night.

dP2vQRFB0xK5bD-aCGZM1w.review_text: Cute place. A bit small though and it gets hot as hell especially on the dance floor. Wasn't there long enough to really give it a proper review, I'll definitely go back and check it out again.

EJIeL4LkaXPkv5cQV6cQOw.review_text: I love the inside of this place with the beautiful rosewood paneling.  I couldn't stop staring and I wasn't stoned or drunk!  The space was cozy and intimate and the extra garden in back was very cute minus gurgling sounds coming from the water attractions.  Nice little dance floor!

9mr1YgKEKOD0Si4v46nqNA.review_text: We were all set to have a Hayley and Ting date night.  The music was great, yelpers were out and havin' fun, the bar looked purty, but after an hour something was wrong.  I had had 3 drinks and was not buzzed in the slightest.  Ting looked at me aghast as she is used to getting me embarrassingly sloppy after 2 drinks.  I am ALWAYS a cheap date (It is a great thing).  After 4 drinks and $40 later we left with only a buzz. On our way to Golden Boy the realization hit me that I hadn't even had dinner!  4 drinks on an empty stomach and all I get was a tiny buzz!  No good Rosewood.

uSCYNal_CJDPGBYUAenyoA.review_text: Decent sort of event space surfing the line between Chinatown and North Beach. Nice wood interior as the name implies, sweet patio, a couple bars.   A good place to host a nondescript event for sure, but it's location probably ensures that not much is going on on any sort of regular night.   I'm going to review it as a bar and call it a three. I'd give it 4 stars as an event space as long as you are bringing your own crowd.

0gEDwhSUIWIBz23MbLYMig.review_text: One year ago my friend Pookie asked me if I wanted to come to Rosewood for some type of party being thrown by a fellow Yelper and his friends.  Being a school night I was hesitant but by this time I was deep into the Yelp pudding and mid-week outings were becoming a regular part of my life.  We walk in and as the name suggests Rosewood is plentiful here, lining almost all of the walls.  It was a great night of drinking and dancing.  The narrow layout made it a bit difficult to navigate to the bar when the place got packed, and the place was like a furnace unless you went out back to the very nice bamboo garden.  Being from the East Bay it came time for Pookie and myself to leave if she was going to be able to get me to a BART station in time for me to get home.  So I walked up to the bar to close out my tab.  While waiting for them to return my card I spotted a gorgeous freckle faced girl with two of her friends standing next to me.  Wow.  I mean...WOW.  I can hardly ever express my *type*.  Maybe I don't have a *type*.  I know what I like when I see it and I was seeing something that I most definitely liked, even if she had way too much (     o     Y     o     ) on display for my taste.  I wanted to buy her and her friends a drink before closing out my tab just so I could talk to her...but I really had to get home.  So without saying a word to her I closed out my tab and went home.  She thinks I didn't notice her that night.  She's wrong.  I fell hard that night, and I'm still falling.  I have no shame whatsoever in saying this.  It's crazy how much can happen in one year.  How fast things can change.  The highs and lows you can experience with one person in such a short period of time.

OKwe2-BIm20cnZmhC0HqaQ.review_text: I really loved this place.  It was small, not crowded and really chill.  I celebrated my sister's birthday earlier this year and am happy to report that we had SUCH a great time.  The music was alright, the drinks were great, and the atmosphere was perfect.  I saw reviews that this place is hit or miss, but the night that we went, it was a complete hit.  Love it, and would love to go again.  So please keep in mind that I went only once for a full night and once before that just to check it out (near closing though).

UzG5IHFUu6H1UyCRbqHHZw.review_text: 2 drinks = sloppy Hayley W.  however, at rosewood,  4 drinks (totaling $40) = sober Hayley W.  happy hour w/Hayley usually means that i'll have a front seat to hilarity, however, rosewood definitely let me down.  it was great to be among fellow yelpers (thanks for helping put the event together, JT F!) and listen to old school hip hop, but the lack of drink-making skills soured the evening.  fyi, rosewood:  decent drinks = more patrons = better business.

V2I8XzyjgEU0y0coLov5sQ.review_text: I came here about three weeks ago for a friend's birthday party.  Like some of the other people I thought the bartenders and the DJ were cool.  I enjoyed the music, or at least what I remember was playing.  The bartenders made me some strong tequila gimlets, with tequila and real lime juice over ice.  This is a plus because I hate it when bartenders used bottled lime juice to make drinks.  I thought the decor was nice and the crowd was stylish.  Even though the bar  is a little on the narrow side, it didn't feel like it.    So why only three stars, just because it is not a place I think I would go to on my own if I was not invited to a celebration.

IkFjRnnI5trMcwHHl_1Vrg.review_text: Rosewood is the only place in North Beach that has stuck around and hasn't gotten too cheesy (perhaps due to size constraints)... I was there for a private party in the back room and would definitely go back for another private party but would be more hesitant on a regular night as the dance floor is ridiculously tiny and the bathroom line is ridiculously long as is the wait for a drink. The back room, however, is perfect. Lots of space to socialize, dance and get a drink while not being shoved around. The outdoor space makes the back room that much better (more ventilation, makes the place seem bigger than it is) as you wouldn't expect a bamboo courtyard on Broadway. The dj this past saturday was spinning some good stuff- I was definitely pleasantly surprised.

dyLZYEJ93cLl6sL_bUOPtQ.review_text: Never too empty, never too crowded (at least when I've been there) which is good with me...plus, Hoegaarden and Chimay, son!

jYyDRSVxLgZrAL8ecd9sPQ.review_text: If you're looking to have a private party, do it here. The back area is great and so are the people that work there.

RCmp-pCAkdAiAcMa2BXwDg.review_text: I have come here only on occasions when either our company or friends rented the place or the back room. The back patio is a cute little hideaway and when it's warm outside, it's the best place to hang out and celebrate. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable and the location is great. Don't know about the prices since it was always open bar when I was here. I heard it's really reasonable price to rent though, compared to a lot of other SF bars. Plus, Julia Allison celebrated her birthday here a couple weeks ago. (Gotta add a fun fact, sometimes...)

EzaSJNXzr-RWWFb96Yt2wQ.review_text: I absolutely LOVEDDDDDDDDD this place! I'm from LA (ughk) and I made a trip up north last week and luckily, stumbled upon this amazingggg place on Friday!   We had no idea where we were gonna go, but we found parking nearby and walked down and this happened to be the first place I saw.. Their bar looked so cute from the window, so we decided to go inside. The guy at the door was so nice! We walked inside and it was pretty empty, but the venue was adorable!! They had a private event going on, which wasn't very private at all, but it was set up with candles and roses. And the outside patio with the lights and trees is just so amazingly romantic!  I absolutely fell in loveee with this place. My birthday's next week and all I kept thinking about was, "Damn! I wish a place like this existed in LA so I could do my birthday here!!"   ROSEWOOD PEOPLE, PLEASE, PLEASEEEEEEE MAKE ANOTHER BAR IN THE LA AREA!! I think Silverlake would be a great location. PLEASE!!!  PS. I'm still looking for a place down in LA to do my birthday, if anyone has any suggestions of places that are similar to Rosewood, please let me know! Thanks!  PPS. One bad thing though, there wasn't a live DJ and there were breaks in between songs where the music completely stopped and everyone on the dance floor stopped dancing.  I still had fun and danced my ass off, but a live DJ or a better playlist would've been nice.

OnagJ2dnPjfRRT4a_CgKCw.review_text: This place stinks. My girlfriend and I went there recently for a few drinks. We knew the crowd would be mainly B&T since it was a Friday night...so no compaints there. My wine was bad so after two sips I moved onto Kettel Soda.. The bartender gave us Kettle Tonic. When I asked him whether he had given us Tonic or Soda he insisted that it was Soda.. SODA WATER IS NOT SWEET...maybe the if bartender was not so distracted with mixing CD's he may have made some decent drinks...overall...the drinks, the music, the crowd STINKS.

XFFCSts3EYKwSZdHZQ4wew.review_text: Held a bridal shower here and it could not have been a better experience.  Toni coordinates all private parties here, and she was the best. I've thrown a lot of private parties at bars/restaurants and this was the most seamless ever. By far!  Highlights: -Toni has a great attitude and gets as pumped for your party as you -She supplied beautiful flowers for the event, completely free of charge! -You are allowed to bring in outside food, for FREE! -We told her we were going to put on a quick fashion show, and she went above and beyond by buying expensive lights just for this! -At one point in the party, she even let us all eat a pizza she had ordered! Ha! -Towards the end of the bridal shower, yes, this was a bridal shower, people started getting into it. It turned into a full on dance party until like 1am, with Toni out there dancing with us!  Hold a party here, you will not be dissapointed! It was too good to be true.

TAw9a920VeW1Jw892jvfqA.review_text: This place looks cool. Nice decor. Bouncer/door guy was friendly enough. Bartenders -  a little slow but it was moderately busy.  I just couldn't get into it.  I was bored. While drinking? Bored??   Had 2 drinks and went back to hotel and slept.

yfy3v_n7BWiGs6pTf58i6A.review_text:
Rosewood, your dim lighting and wood themes, which include wood walls and hollowed-out wooden pendant lamps, manage to create an intimate feel in spite of the heavy Broadway Tunnel traffic outdoors and the blasting Tupac inside. (Note: Tupac = good thing. I'm not complaining about the music in any way; in fact, it was perfect for a little groovin'-in-your-seat chair dancing.) Anyway, continuing... Rosewood, somehow you manage to do wood-paneling in a hip, trendy, non-70s-porno way. Your drinks are strong, and your decor is understated and chic. Your crowd is chill and non-sketchy despite your proximity to the strip clubs -- *ahem* -- "dance" revues two blocks away.
  However, Rosewood, how in the name of all that's antibacterial can you NOT have soap in your bathroom?! My hands, my hands!!! *looks down in horror* My haaaaaaands!

y9-bfJEhXvU98vwt5UejuA.review_text: I agree with the other reviews here in that it's a smaller bar with a little dance floor that is usually no hassles to get in.  It has a simmering hip vibe to it, but when we went last night it was a bit more packed than I remember it being previously.  After about 1230 a bunch of people left (maybe a big party was there) and it returned to a more relaxed uncrowded atmosphere.    My biggest issue with Rosewood is that they have this gigantic bar and the bartenders only work half of it.  So instead of being able to get a drink easily you have to fight through all the idiots who buy a drink and don't clear the F out of the way and the whole time you're left wondering why when there's an empty bar section steps away.  The end result is overcrowding at one end of the bar and a lot of spilled drinks as you make your way back to the other parts of the bar.  I'd still go back, but hopefully someone at Rosewood sees this and makes a simple change to fix it.

h5qf9owtv9q8HjaNcrz3OQ.review_text: Maybe a cursory review, but I stopped by briefly at a private party and really liked the ambiance.  Very dark wood, with an outdoor component.  If only it wasn't so out of the way...

GuMkSUhINdQlOvZy0MmSTw.review_text: rosewood has a nice decor.  it's got a loungey feel which makes it stick out on broadway street.  upon first entering, it looks like a tiny little lounge but there's a whole back section that has a patio area (its reminiscent of b412 in Palo Alto).  good place to chill for drinks and move on. wouldn't make rosewood my whole night.

R7atWnGlDkXTzS78iwH7Xg.review_text: Rosewood is a secret classy bar in North Beach on Broadway.  Ok, maybe it's not secret, but it's not your usual Broadway establishment (you know what I mean...).    Good drinks, not too pricey if I remember correctly...I don't think I do because I was in rare form the last time I was here but when I checked my credit card statement it wasn't as bad as I thought it would be.  It's not too packed so you have room to make any piece of the floor you and your friend's own little dance floor.  The staff is friendly and you don't have to push and shove or wait long for a drink at the bar.    Me likey.

gjhzKWsqCIrpEd9pevbKZw.review_text: Just about the only bar in North Beach I'd go to willingly.  If you can will yourself to ignore the sometimes deplorable crowd, you'll enjoy this sleek place. It's beautiful inside and comfortable too if you can procure a spot to sit.  Far better on weeknights than on weekend nights.

6BPWg3w-B0IphHnePrYt-w.review_text: I had an opportunity to attend a Yelp event yesterday at Rosewood.  The interior is dark but the bar portion was lighted with orangish lights.  That gave a sophisticated outlook.  At the back of the club is a dance space where all the walls are made of hard woods so you could feel the low base vibration from all of them.  The drink I had was pretty strong, so I, not a heavy drinker, just needed one drink.  Bartenders werecool enough to give ma a cup of Coke and club soda for free, so I left them a tip respectively.  Now regarding the event...  I got to receive greetings from JT and Omar, while I was able to take to Gracy, Jessica, and a couple others that I've met at other Yelp gatherings.  People there were very relaxed, and I did not have that out-of-place feeling.  DJ's were also playing a slightly older songs so people over there probably felt like they were high school students again (just as I did).  I haven't danced for a while, and probably haven't exercised enough so couldn't dance as much as I wanted.  Oh well, maybe next time.

YJTQ5eqVasyhY28jdtC6pQ.review_text: Came here last night with my hubby and a couple of friends, we got there kinda late (11:45), but what's great about the place is that there's no cover!   They have a fully stocked bar and the bartenders were very quick. The place wasn't super packed but it's always better when you can move around.   There's also ample seating room and a small dance room in the back.   I'm definitely old now, too much loud music gets to me after a while, but I'll be back when I need a night out and I'm not in the mood to deal with youngsters!

oul-lnrhw-c4SMargr_72w.review_text: Celebrated my friend's birthday here.    It's a good sized place, cozy but not cramped.  We were in the back room, which was an outside area and had tables and benches for us to sit and chat.  The drinks were good, but our bartender was slow.  I allowed someone who was about to leave cut in front of me so that she could order the birthday girl a drink, and ended up wishing I hadn't because I ended up waiting at least 10-15 minutes while our bartender mixed everything up.  Other friends echoed this criticism about how slow it was.  Other than that, everything was good.  I liked the ambiance of the place, and there was a coat rack with hangers so that I didn't have to hang on to my jacket all night.

y_COVWJOTUWAnm7E92iHIw.review_text: I love this place! I hadn't been back for a while and decided to bring some friends for my birthday. It was small enough to not lose people but big enough for mingling and not feeling claustrophobic.   The highlight of my night (other than all the awesome friends) was seeing that they'd named a drink special after me! Thanks to Toni, who was great to work with - all I did was email her and she had a table reserved for me when I got there and I didn't even request it!   This bar is definitely one of my favorites in the city, definitely recommend for groups and parties!

VjUuaL2A0QwrRZ8hDdFf7Q.review_text: the only place you'll find me drinking hoegaarden on the weekend after the sun goes down.  i'm docking them one star for distracting me from their famous lychee martini with pear flavored absolut shots.  and giving them four stars for helping me verify the whole "beer before liquor never sicker" theory.  it's gospel, baby!

QPpPIMxWWDAWP376voLWtw.review_text: Trouble on the horizon? Arrived 7:30pm Wednesday night to find the entrance blocked by an illustrious SF homeless bundle. There were no signs indicating why the bar was closed, no paper covering the windows- perhaps the owners didn't want to wake the sleeping doorway dweller?

qIDy9zJfCuqxy6A3exPe_w.review_text: Low-key place with a nice dimly lit ambiance. Randomly placed in Chinatown. Never gets crowded.

_tYdp-NhWaKnwYveFE2JnA.review_text: The bf and I came here one night to meet a few friends. There were two parties (one in the front and one in the back), and the manager Toni was SO nice and accommodating. She checked with the front party to make sure it was ok for us to be there (we just wanted to get a few of their great scratch cocktails and dance a little, nothing sloppy), and she even showed us the back patio and explained pricing for private parties. I have to say that the pricing that she gave out was completely reasonable, and the outdoor space is so awesome, we're trying to come up with a reason to have a party there! To top it off, we got 5 drinks on our tab and the total came to less than $35 including tip, and the drinks a mixture of beers, cocktails and whiskey! Great service and price in a cool space definitely deserves 5 stars.

eUmVXP9UnoWtz9NSBwY4jA.review_text: I've been a fan of Rosewood since day one (I'm OG like that)   Like must North Beach bars it gets crowded on the weekends but during the week it's the perfect spot to grab a drink or three.  Plus the backyard patio is a hidden gem.  PD says check it out.

BdRMVROS1MXOHxr-bdZv0g.review_text: This venue is a total treasure for special events. Toni is fun and exuberant and super open to ideas.  We had a brunch party there for 80 people and worked closely with Toni on specialty drinks and punch bowls and a "champagne bar".  Her team put in so much work and we got such a great price for everything.  Would do another event here in a heartbeat! The outdoor patio space is really fantastic.

CDZWiihsmtiP-cgBRSSljA.review_text: The high point of the evening was posing as Spider-Man in the outdoor patio in a little alcove right under somebody's window.  Not that there weren't a lot of high points, but you must agree, that's a pretty high point.  Angelo's 30th was awesome - we got here a little before the major crowd showed up, in the hopes of leaving the city early, before the club kid crowd clogs up the freeway entrances.  The plan worked perfectly.  The space in the back is quite accommodating, even if you have to go through a room that looks like a slaughterhouse before you get there. :*(  The space in the front is quite swanky, even more so given the part of Broadway it sits on, right before the tunnel.  We came across the bay, got a parking garage, got our instructions on how to drop off the key after hours, and headed on over to Rosewood . . .   a few hours later, after hanging out at one of the most well-publicized 30th birthdays in Yelp history, we met various interesting people, had a good Manhattan, Moscow Mule, or two, and just generally hung out.  Sure, the drinks were a little expensive for the locale and for the drinks themselves, but the company was well worth it.  DJ was great, both indoors and out.  Somebody who always dances on a table ended up dancing on a table, and I called it.  Everyone looked great, and the trip across the bay was well worth it, even on a work night.  Thanks Angelo!  And the stop at the Lusty Lady on the way back fo the parking garage didn't hurt matters any. ;-)

WnzRueYdRWNSbkXB0_0i4Q.review_text: I really enjoy this bar. I've been here twice and although it's tucked between Broadway's Chinatown 400 Chinese restaurants (seriously, it's like a mirage in the desert), it is beautifully designed and always a good time. There is a back patio and bar that's nicely decorated with bamboo trees and redwood furniture that makes it look like a nestled hideout in the forest. The staff and drinks are great too. I'm a fan. Parking is also better than certain parts of downtown too.

Og1g9HC0J4X97Wszgiav7Q.review_text: Very friendly staff and great cocktails... Kit did an amazing job introducing us to new drinks and making us feel like we were regulars.

Ud6j2HN40qEhycq2PuwcBA.review_text: Great vibe and crowd at this bar, thanks to Julio and Cassio for organizing the Summer Tuesdays Happy Hour. Met lots of Yelpers that I've not seen in awhile....great conversation and laughter, awesomely good time. Will be back....

YxRRrYeupc0a_JJaPKcd0A.review_text: My friends and I threw ourselves a joint, private birthday bash at Rosewood, and it was a great experience! Toni, the host, made planning everything a smooth and seamless.  Rosewood is divided into two areas: a front, which encompasses the main bar and the dance floor, and the back, which has a separate bar and an outdoor patio. The two areas are available for separate private party reservations. Our group had the front of the place.   In addition to the friendliness of the staff in general and Toni in particular, a few things really stood out about the experience: * We got to choose custom drinks with custom names on them. Since it was a joint birthday party, we chose as drink names the names of the birfday peeps. This is a small little touch that goes a long way in making the party feel personal! * We got to control the music on the dance floor! \ * When we walked in, the place was beautifully decorated with balloons and candles. We were not expecting this and it was a pleasant surprise.   All in all, highly recommended if you are planning a party!

_pIG1_s6Bzymn1zeyLjBHQ.review_text: Want to party it up to great music, have terrific drinks, pick up hot women, spot out studly men, and have the time of your life?  Don't go here then.  And that's all I've got to say about that.

Rn9nlb3sFJ_a6W6DE7PZmA.review_text: Rosewood is set in the middle of an dark and empty (night-time) block.  You might even pass it by completely if you didn't know it was there... but don't!  The minute we stepped inside the warmth was tangible.  The front room is wood paneled (fake, by the looks of it) but somehow maintains a classy rather than 80's basement look (you know what I'm talkin' about East-coasters).  We arrived early to set-up for a special birthday celebration and so the place was empty and candles were still being lit.  The private area is spacious - two rooms, a bar and patio access (the patio is candlelight and bamboo gorgeousness even if there is a shower ventilation window right above).  We decorated with some lights and pretty paper on the wall to liven up the private areas.  All the staff - from the bartenders to the bouncer were friendly and helpful - even moving furniture to set the ambiance. Yummy drinks  - ask Benito to mix up something special for you!  There was also an Ipod set-up for the birthday girl's playlist.  Rosewood is nice for a drop-in situation and awesome for private parties!

dTdltcr2EC5oMZ1rs795PA.review_text: ive been here a lot.  it does help that i live in the area.  would have given this a 4, but i've got a few gripes.  the bouncer (same guy always) makes you wait in line, when there's people inside, or strangely enough, when there's not a lot of people inside.  the bartenders arent very fast.  the bathroom line extends to the dance floor.  despite the seemingly negatives above, i do like the place, and find myself here a lot.  it's a cool little bar in northbeach that gets you away from the lower broadway strip.

0FbtB0ajpk8VZSVpC6KjGw.review_text: Rosewood is a little hidden but its worth finding.  This small North Beach bar has a great atmosphere and its a great place to shake your booty. A little small but if you've really got the urge to dance you'll find a way right? Great hip hop, the DJ is right behind the bar so you can sit and have a drink while you watch him spin. Good times!

gjZp61JZaqcLrKjEDVSPIQ.review_text: This place has a real New York vibe.  Good martini.

8oFZEpX00zZS1Dku2aKfcQ.review_text: randomly in the middle of chinatown, when walking down the empty streets in the middle of the night, you would never notice that this place is a bar. WHen you walk in though, it's pretty nice and you definitely feel like you've walked out of chinatown and walked into SOMA or Union Square.  Cute little bar, pretty classy. Given, only time I've been here was for a private party and the back room is perfect for that. It's a cute back area with a patio (given there is no lighting outside so rather dark but nice nook if you want to get away from the crowds). There is not a separate DJ in the back though, you have to provide your own music. However, there is a separate bar in the back; given they don't stock it fully so there was some issues of having to go back and forth between the front and back bars because they had to keep transferring goods for us.   Definitely had a good time; however, it is kind of out there and again in the middle of Chinatown with nothing around. So unless you want to hold a private party that's going to last, I'd suggest going elsewhere. I haven't gone here just to go to the bar, so not sure how it is on other nights, because let's be honest. The private party in the back made up about 40% of the everyone in the building.

OFPNE_TTnl9TAEQxrTK23w.review_text: Cool off the beaten path North Beach bar with a big dance room in the back and a great DJ! The bar was small and very intimate with a great bar keep. Had a great time here and good vibes. Just off the beaten path and wish there were more to do around here. Can't really see myself going here unless it was rented out or some private event. Good times, so check it out without fear if you have a reason to be here.  Cheers!

ZnoRV0CJYbKqHlWWm_6MIA.review_text: So i've had 2 completely different experiences here. One thing I've learned, keep your eye open if it's your first time: the door is hard to fine. Find the large unmarked modern looking rosewood door, with the word "rosewood" in metal cutouts above, squished between the normal scrubby looking Chinatown structures.  It is strangely located in Chinatown, because when you walk in, it feels as though you are in a completely different area.   Environment: Modern looking, very neatly designed. Front area has the bar, little areas to lounge around in. Then a dance floor, proceeding to the back are more areas to hang out. A patio too! The dance floor with the usual "club" music mixes...along with mini tables dimly lit with candles.  People: WAY busy on a weekend night. Too many partiers here. Seems like a more snobby-I like to party all the time crowd. Bar- ran out of cups?? So we had to wait.   Visit 1: It was for a private party. We were located in the back, so I had a leisurely time.   Visit  2: Way chaotic in there. Bf couldn't stand the crowd-he was just scootchin by and an ignorant male bystander decided to ask him why he was trying to touch his butt. There's 1 inch of space to move around in, what do you expect? Waited way too long for the bathroom. Got pushed by by a VERY drunk girl in rags stumbling all over the floor, which she proceeded to the bathroom to throw up. Then as she walked out she was dragging her body all over the floor. Then threw up right in front of my bf. good call.   Experience could've been better. I think that night was way too crowded, and I believe on a more slow night, a casual relaxing time would make the place more pleasant. So overall, average, but nothing to really be thrilled about.

AlpltTc9Y8k8A4x5239JUw.review_text: The staff at Rosewood goes above and beyond to ensure that their customers are treated with the utmost hospitality and have a great time while at their establishment.   My cousin organized a birthday party here and, Toni, the manager left no detail unnoticed to make sure her event was seamless. She reserved the front part of the bar (which is huge, complete with an almost private dance floor) for us - signs, candles and custom drink menus (that she was able to choose the names for in advance) were framed throughout the bar. They let us know in advance that we'd be able to be completely responsible for music, if we chose to do so, so we were able to make playlists on our iPhones in preparation for her event at Rosewood.  The bar itself looks quaint from the street and can almost be overlooked, but once you get inside it's completely renovated and classy. There's a beautiful outdoor area and private section in the back that seems perfect for a private party or event.  Thank you, Rosewood, for a great night!

L3GWuD2vJbsMGlzrtZtDJw.review_text: You had me at outdoor patio and helluva good drinks!  Have been to rosewood multiple times and I am happy to say that every single time I've had a great time. Not just mingling with friends but appreciating the sheer talent and generousness (if I may say so) of the gifted bartenders.  The outdoor patio is big enough and looks all cutesy with the lights.  The music - every single time it's been great, toonies I can dance to or just enjoy while conversing w/ friends, very smooth transition as well.

LdWIjNvjdaAoAfpQhT6F9w.review_text: If you're coming here, don't forget to write the address down, or you might end up wandering up and down the block like we did. Broadway between Powell and Stockton - that's all I could remember.    Luckily, now that I've got my new LASIK vision, the inconspicuous entrance of Rosewood could not escape from my sight. It was there, middle of the street. We were tempted to just run across the street. We were just so happy to have finally found it. Wouldn't it have been embarrassing to get there, park the car, wander up and down that same block, only to give up and go home?! And then - the next day, read about everyone's great time?    I truly believe that one's experience anywhere is altered by the company. And I've found that any time I'm around a large group of crazy Yelpers, there is much fun to be had.    We got there super early because I didn't want to stay too long. Of course, that threw itself out the back patio when the people started pouring in, and the drinks were pouring themselves! TOO MUCH FUN.  Seriously though - attentive bartenders, comfy leather seats, itty bitty dance floor, back patio, cheap Chinese food within walking distance. And if the party gets a little crazy in THAT sorta way, there are places to go just a few blocks away - NOT.

QBXAIu1Vm-nKXUwBqZ5H7Q.review_text: Having a 30th birthday party is a good idea. Great back room, nice private area, patio to mingle in on a warm SF night and your own bouncer? Sweet!  It was a night of watching the bf turn into a webbed superhero, champagne cocktails, dancing in the bathroom line to Groove is in the Heart, getting lost IN the bathroom (it was late) and table dancing.  The staff was accomodating, the DJ played what everybody (drunk and sober alike) could dance to and it's an area of North Beach not immediately known as the Bermuda Douche Triangle.  Bravo, Angelo, Bravo, for getting a bunch of crazy folk together for your epic event.

2fN8mN7uUjOw-QqtcgYqXQ.review_text: Food: 3 Decor: 3 Service: 3  Came here for a company event, which was open bar.  Pros: -outdoor patio  Cons: -small venue -long waits for ordering drinks -so-so drinks

fSvOdnryI9FPJ2ylcsE2ig.review_text: WHAT HAPPENED? Did they change ownership or something here? So, I went last night and immediately noticed that the furniture had been moved so that all of the couches are now against the wall. Ok, it makes more space for the bar area, but it really didn't matter because it was so empty last night at around 10pm.  Not really noticing any difference, I ordered my usual, a french martini.  #1, they didn't have pineapple, which is a key ingredient... #2 they used pomegrante liquor instead of chambord and #3 they changed out their martini glasses for this curvy and MUCH smaller pseudo martini looking glass that more closely resembled a curvy margarita glass. My friend was so angry at me for bringing him to this strange place that we both didn't finish our drinks and left. His drink, a cranberry vodka with a splash of pineapple (but no pineapple) tasted like a freaking postage stamp.  So, what happened? After this dismal experience I probably won't be back, unless I absolutely have to go, plus it's off the beaten track. Oh and the music was just weird weird weird...
